He participated as an instrumentalist of Grupo de Caxangá, which was directed by the violinist João Pernambuco. The group used to show up during the Carnival at the Rio Branco avenue with their members using northeastern costumes.
His first composition, the tango Dominante, was recorded this year by the Bloco dos Parafusos for the Odeon label.

Release of the songs Sofres porque queres and Rosa, both recorded by Pixinguinha and his group. However, the waltz Rosa would be noticed after the 1930 decade with the record of Orlando Silva and with the verses from a mechanic who lived in Meier.

In response to an invitation to create a group that would present at the lounge in the Palais theatre, Pixinguinha formed the Os Oito Batutas. This formation was a success; it gathered prominent musicians of the moment as Donga and Nelson Gonçalves. The band played in the following year in a concert for the King and Queen of Belgium who were visiting Brazil.

With Os Oito Batutas, Pixinguinha went for his first European tour. They did concerts for six months and could get great success when played at the Sherazade cabaret, in Paris. Pixinguinha won from Arnaldo Guinle, who was the sponsor of the tour, his first saxophone.
With Os Oito Batutas, Pixinguinha travels to South Brazil and Argentina. In Buenos Aires, the group records several songs for Victor label, among them O Urubu and O gavião.

He presented himself as the orchestra of Cine Rialto conductor, in a concert of the Companhia Negra de Revista, which was formed only for black people. During this presentation he met Albertina da Rocha, who would be his future wife.
With his friend and violinist Donga, he organized the Típica Pixinguinha-Donga Orchestra. With the group he recorded in the same year his first version (no lyrics) of his classic Carinhoso.

He was hired as an exclusive musician and arranger for the Victor Brasileira records. Worked with groups such as the Victor Brasileira Orchestra and Diabos do Céu Orchestra. Consolidated his career as the creator of Brazilian school of arrange by writing orchestrations that would become classics of Brazilian popular music.

Creates the Grupo da Guarda Velha, group formed by famous musicians such as Luiz Americano, Donga, João da Bahiana, among others. The group did many records for Victor with participation of singers such as Carmen Miranda and Mário Reis.
He founded the orchestra Diabos do Céu, with which he would make hundreds of records along the following years with prominent singers such as Carmen Miranda and Francisco Alves, among others.

It was released the classic Carinhoso, with lyrics by João de Barros and interpreted by the singer Orlando Silva. This would be the most famous song of Pixinguinha. It was re-recorded many times on the following decades.

Invited by Villa-Lobos, Pixinguinha acted as instrumentalist of the recordings done by the conductor Leopoldo Stokowski at the studio in the docked ship Uruguai, at Praça Mauá in Rio de Janeiro. Among the musicians were Donga, Cartola, João da Bahiana and Luiz Americano.

He replaced the flute for the tenor saxophone and did a series of recordings as duet with the flutist Benedito Lacerda. Among the songs recorded are the choros Um a zero, Ainda me recordo, O gato e o canário and Os oito batutas.

He did his first appearance as arranger and instrumentalist at the radio show O Pessoal da Velha Guarda, presented and produced by Almirante. During 6 years the show presented arranges and orchestration by Pixinguinha for classics of choros and sambas of the first decades of 20th century.

Participates in the I Festival da Velha Guarda, organized by Almirante in São Paulo. The Festival was part of celebrations for the city anniversary and had great names of Brazilian popular music such as Pixinguinha, Donga, Ismael Silva, among others.
He recorded by Sinter the LPs "Carnaval de Nássara", "Marchinhas Carnavalescas de João de Barros e Alberto Ribeiro" and "Assim é que é".
Composes the soundtrack for the movie "Sol sobre a lama", by Alex Viany. Becomes a partner of Vinicius de Morais, who put lyrics in the choro Lamentos and many others Pixinguinha's songs.

Release, by RCA Victor and Museu da Imagem e do Som (Image and Sound Museum), the LP "Pixinguinha 70", recorded live in the concert at the Municipal Theatre of Rio de Janeiro during celebrations for his 70th birthday.

descricao: Conductor, pianist teacher. He was the son of an Italian flautist Alfredo Mignone who immigrated to Brazil in 1896. Considered very important in classical music but participating generously in popular music, he used the pseudonym Chico Bororo. He was a member of the Brazilian Academy of Music and founder of the Brazilian Conservatory of Music.

item.texto: At the age of 13 he appeared as a flautist and pianist in small orchestras and started to compose popular works as “Chico Bororó”.

He debuted at Municipal Theatre of Rio de Janeiro as a soloist in the orchestra in Concerto em lá menor by Edvard Grieg (1843-1907) and introduced his work Suíte Campestre amongst others he had written.
He goes to the Milan Conservatory to study with the master Vincenzo Ferroni. The influence of Italian esthetics can be noted in his first opera O Contratador de Diamantes.

After the creation of his second opera L’Innocente, he engaged in the quest for a nationalistic esthetic, under the influence of Mario de Andrade, becoming one of the composers who most represented Nationalism in Brazilian music.
His Symphonic Poem No sertão (1925), inspired by the book Os Sertões by Euclides da Cunha, won the first prize in a competition at the Symphonic Concerts Society of São Paulo.
He composes the Afro-Brazilian ballet Maracatu de Chico-Rei together with Mario de Andrade.
He becomes a teacher of conducting at the National Music Institute of Rio de Janeiro. At this time he composes his 3ª Fantasia brasileira for piano and orchestra and for piano and string orchestra.

obras.titulo: Fantasia Brasileira n.3 para piano e orquestra de cordas
Fantasia Brasileira n.3 para piano e orquestra sinfônica

item.texto: Composes the symphonic poem Festa das Igrejas, recorded by Toscanini and Quadros Amazônicos.
He becomes director of the Municipal Theatre of Rio de Janeiro.
He composes Sinfonia Tropical for orchestra.
In the decade of the 70's he resumes his tonal works with the exception of his church music and compositions for the guitar such as Concerto para violão e orquestra.

The 100th anniversary of the birth of the composer is commemorated with the release of three records by the pianist Maria Josefina, his widower: Valsas imortais, with 12 valsas-choro and 12 valsas-de-esquina; 17 Choros para Piano de Francisco Mignone and Duo Mignone - Momentos históricos, re-releases of recordings by the Duo tha Maria Josefina formed with Mignone.

descricao: Rio de Janeiro native of Spanish descent, Lorenzo Fernandez was a student of Francisco Braga and Henrique Oswald in Instituto Nacional de Música (National Institute of Music) where he became a professor. He was director and one of the founders of Conservatório Brasileiro de Música (Brazilian Conservatory of Music). His works were genuinely nationalists but without any resemblance to folklore. He was characterized by particularly elegant harmonic writing.

item.texto: Enters Instituto Nacional de Música where he becomes a student of Henrique Oswald and Francisco Braga.
Starts to stand out as a composer by participating in a contest with compositions for piano, Noturno and Arabesca, and with Cisnes e Ausência, for singing and orchestra.

With his first important work, the Trio brasileiro, representing his nationalist tendencies, he receives first place in the composing competition of an extinct Sociedade de Cultura Musical (Society of Musical Culture), an entity that he founded. He also composes his first concert for piano and orchestra, Primeiro concerto.
Premiere of the composer's first work for orchestra, Suíte sinfônica, that consists of three Brazilian folk themes.
Dedicates to his Suíte Reisado do Pastoreio for orchestra. This composition consists of a famous part Batuque, a play that has been included in repertoires of the great conductors since then.
Composes a choreographic poem, Amaya.

Establishes Conservatório Brasileiro de Música (Brazilian Conservatory of Music). As a director of this entity he promotes recitals, concerts and open courses as well as encourages implementation of modern pedagogy in children's musical education. He remains the director until his death.
Composes his second Suíte brasileira.
Finishes composing his Segunda sinfonia inspired by O Caçador de Esmeraldas by Olavo Bilac. The composition has never been performed in his lifetime.
Premiere of his Primeira sinfonia (1945) performed by Orquestra Sinfônica Brasileira (Brazilian Symphony Orchestra) conducted by Eleazar de Carvalho.

obras.titulo: Variações sinfônicas sobre um tema popular brasileiro para piano e orquestra

descricao: Milton Amaral, the artistic name of Antonio Amaral de Oliveira, composed many songs and sambas in the first half of 20th century. His first composition - samba Tatuí - was recorded in 1929 by Arthur Castro. In 1934 Gaston Formenti recorded one of Milton Amaral's greatest hits, the waltz Folhas ao vento, re-recorded 4 years later by Vicente Celestino.

Alcebíades Barcellos, o Bide, nasceu em Niterói. Aos seis anos, mudou-se com a família para o bairro do Estácio, no Rio de Janeiro. Iniciou sua vida profissional como sapateiro, mas logo passou a frequentar as rodas de samba de seu bairro. Foi um dos fundadores da primeira escola de samba, a “Deixa Falar”. Compôs com grandes nomes, mas foi com Armando Marçal a parceria mais constante, da qual se destaca Agora é cinza.

Composer, he had an important role to history of samba in Rio de Janeiro, especialy at samba school Estação Primeira de Mangueira, which he was one of the founders. Born and raised in Morro da Mangueira, a carioca neighborhod, he met Cartola, his most frequent partner. He was responsible for inclusion of historical elements in the sambas, which would later become a common practice.

item.texto: He founded, along with friends, the Bloco dos Arengueiros, a musical group of Morro da Mangueira.
He starts to work at Central do Brasil, a railroad company. Carlos would work there until his retirement in 1965.
His samba Chega de demanda, in a partnership with Cartola, is chosen for the Samba School parade.
HIs composition Não quero mais, in a partnership with Cartola and Zé da Zilda, was recorded by the famous singer Aracy de Almeida.

obras.titulo: Não Quero Mais Amar A Ninguém

item.texto: Elizete Cardoso records the samba Não quero mais amar a ninguém.
Clara Nunes, other famous singer, records his samba Alvorada.
Launches his first solo LP "Carlos Cachaça".

descricao: Also known as Kid Morengueira, he lived a very poor childhood. At age of 20 started his career as a sambista and composer. Moreira created the famous "samba de breque", a samba that includes dictated sentences which was a landmark this period. Although his fame as a sassy man, in fact he never really acted like that being just a genious and irreverent composer.

item.texto: He sings the samba Jogo proibido (by Tancredo Silva, D. Silva and R. Cunha) in Teatro Meyer. For the first time he includes dictated sentences when the music stops, creating the known "samba-de-breque".

descricao: Born in São Paulo, Walter moved to Rio de Janeiro in 1914, where he studied with Henrique Oswald. He began his international career in conducting and always demonstrated high esteem to Brazilian music. There are three notable pieces from his works, and they are Concerto para violoncelo e orquestra, Canção das duas folhas and Coral sertanejo, for voices, and Violeiros de Guaratiba, for acoustic guitar solo.

Nascido no bairro da Cidade Nova, frequentou o Café Nice na década de 1930, conheceu alguns dos maiores compositores de música popular da época. A partir de então inicia parceria musical com nomes como Braguinha, Nássara, Radamés Gnattali, entre outros. Deixou inúmeras composições, entre elas sucessos como Chiquita bacana e Touradas em Madrid, ambas com João de Barro.

One of the samba-exaltation genre precursors, is the author of Aquarela do Brasil, his most famous samba. Adopted by the city of Rio de Janeiro, fanatic Flamengo football team, he was not only a composer, football commentator and radio broadcaster. Produced a great work with hundreds of compositions that include classics as No rancho fundo and Camisa Amarela.

item.texto: With the death of his father, Dr. João Evangelista Barroso (state representative and prosecutor in Ubá) and mother, Mrs. Evangelina, he is adopted by Dona Gabriela, his grandmother and Rita, the great-aunt. With her starts to learn piano.
Moves to Rio de Janeiro where he began to attend law school. Would take nine years to graduate; nevertheless he never would exercise the legal profession.
Without money to support himself in Rio, starts working as a pianist at the Cine Iris, in Largo da Carioca.
Becomes pianist conductor of Sebastião Cirino orchestra, starting to show in the waiting room of the Carlos Gomes Theater.

He began his career as a composer of theather with two songs for Laranja da China, a play by Olegário Mariano and Luiz Peixoto: Vou a Penha (which would be recorded in the same year by the singer Mário Reis) and Vamos deixar de intimidades, his first major success.
Receives the first award in the contest of Carnival songs promoted by Casa Edison, with the song Dá Nela.

Premiere of the theater play “É do Balacobaco” by Vitor Pujol and Marques Porto, which included the song Na grota funda by Ary Barroso and lyrics by the caricaturist J. Carlos. Music would receive in the same year new lyrics of Lamartine Babo, changing the name to No rancho fundo, one of the biggest hits of the duo.
Starts his career in radio working as a singer and pianist in the radio programs Horas do Outro Mundo by Renato Murce and Programa Casé, both at Radio Philips.

Debut as a sportscaster giving an emotional and passionate tone to transmissions of football matches, in this role, he would also be known for the fact of playing a little harmonica every time that had a goal, and his passion for Flamengo football team.

Releases in Cruzeiro do Sul radio station his first talent show. Throughout his career he would present the same program in several radio stations and later on TV Tupi, revealing names such as  Dolores Duran, Elza Soares and Elizeth Cardoso.

Composes for the Entra na Faixa music magazine the samba Aquarela do Brasil. Recorded in the same year by Francisco Alves with famous arrangement of Radamés Gnattali, this samba would be the most successful composer song, with hundreds of rewrites in Brazil and abroad.

Did two trips to the USA after the international launch of the songs No tabuleiro da bahiana and  Aquarela do Brasil. That same year composes the samba Rio de Janeiro for the film Brazil released by Republic Pictures and nominated for the Oscar for best soundtrack of the year.
He was elected alderman of the city of Rio de Janeiro by UDN (National Democratic Union). Engages in the received position, actively works for the construction of Maracanã Stadium.
Release of the songs Folha Morta, recorded by Dalva de Oliveira, and “Risque”, recorded by Aurora Miranda.
Organizes the Orchestra Brazilian Rhythms, performing tour in Venezuela and Mexico.
Receives, with Villa-Lobos, the National Order of Merit, honour that is made in a ceremony presided over by President Café Filho
Becomes vice president of the cultural department of Flamengo football club, his favorite club.

descricao: One of the main responsible for diluting the barriers between the erudite and popular in Brazil, Radamés Gnattali was a pianist, composer and an arranger. He performed in basically all fields, leaving a large artwork of symphonic and chamberistic music, besides being one of the most important Brazilian arrangers with at least five decades of performance in popular music. He has left artworks yet to be discovered.

item.texto: At age of six, he begins studying piano with his mother, Mrs. Adélia Fossati Gnattali.
Begins his violin studies with his cousin Olga Fossati.
He begins formal studies in music at Conservatory of Porto Alegre having piano classes with  Guilherme Fontainha, who would later became the director of the National Institute of Music.
He begins working as pianist at the Confeitaria Colombo in Porto Alegre.
Concludes his piano course at the Conservatory of Porto Alegre and performs for the first time in Rio de Janeiro, in a concert at the National Institute of Music.
Composes his first chamber piece, Reminiscência, for violin, piano, flute and bassoon.
Debut as a concertist at the Theater of Rio de Janeiro, with the Tchaikowsky's piano concert and regency of Arnaldo Glükmann.
Composes the choro Alma Brasileira and the Prelúdios n. 2 and 3, for solo piano.
He moves to Rio de Janeiro with the goal of passing a contest to become a gownsman at the National Institute of Music. Composes Rapsódia Brasileira for two pianos.
Begins performing at the popular market participating as a pianist at the orchestras of Victor do Brasil and Diabos do Céu, under Pixinguinha's direction.
His first popular songs are launched by the recorder Victor: the waltzes Vibrações D’alma and Saudosa, and the polka-choro Conversa Fiada.
He conducts a tour through South Brazil with the singer Bidu Sayão. Releases by Odeon label his choro Serenata no Joá and the waltz Wilma, both interpreted by the clarinetist Luiz Americano.
Debut his Concerto n. 1 for piano and orchestra at the Theater of Rio de Janeiro, performing himself as soloist. The label Victor launches his choros Saudoso and Tristonho.

obras.titulo: Concerto n. 1 para piano e orquestra

item.texto: Gnattali is hired by National Radio of Rio de Janeiro as an arranger, pianist and regent.
Releases by Victor label his choros Cabuloso and Recordando, both performed by the Trio Carioca with Gnattali at the piano, Luiz Americano at the clarinet and Luciano Perrone at the drums.
First release in disc of an erudicte work of the composer: the Quarteto Borgerth records its Quarteto n. 1 for violins and cello through Columbia label.
His Rapsódia Brasileira, performed by New Zealander pianist Ester Ficher, is transmited by B.B.C. of London.

Debuts the radio program “Um milhão de melodias”, directed by Almirante and having Radamés as an arranger and orchestra's regent. In the same year the composer switches to another recorder, leaving Victor for Continental, where he records his choro Remexendo.
His Brasiliana n.1 is recorded by BBC's Symphonic Orchestra of London with the conductor Clarence Reybould.

Release of his samba-canção Fim de tarde performed by Quarteto Continental, having the author himself at the piano, José Menezes at the guitar, Pedro Vidal at the bass and Luciano Perrone at the drums. This song would later be considered one of precursors of Bossa Nova.

Concertino n. 2 for guitar and orchestra debuts in Rio de Janeiro, performed by Garoto (Aníbal Augusto Sardinha) and the Symphonic Orchestra Theater of Rio de Janeiro under regency of maestro Eleazar de Carvalho.

obras.titulo: Concertino n. 2 para violão e orquestra

item.texto: Worldwide release of Concerto para harmônica de boca e orquestra de câmara, with Edu da Gaita as soloist and the Brazilian Symphonic Orchestra.

obras.titulo: Concerto para harmônica de boca e orquestra de câmara

item.texto: The composer conducts a tour in Europe with his sextet, with Radamés himself and Aída Gnattali (piano), José Menezes (electric guitar), Chiquinho do Acordeom, Pedro Vidal (Bass) and Luciano Perrone (drums).
It is released the Suíte Retratos in LP (CBS label) for mandolin, string orchestra and regional groups. The soloist was Jacob do Bandolim, to whom the piece was dedicated and its regent was Radamés.
The composer is hired by Rede Globo Television, where he works until the end of his life.
The LP Radamés Gnattali Sextet is launched by Odeon, with the songs Meu amigo Tom Jobim and Divertimento, for six instruments.

The show Tributo a Jacob do Bandolim debuts, which was produced by Hermínio Bello de Carvalho. The show took place at Sala Funarte in Rio de Janeiro, having Radamés himself at the piano, Joel Nascimento and the Camerata Carioca.
The LP Uma Rosa para Pixinguinha is released, having Radamés at the piano, the singer Elizeth Cardoso and the Camerata Carioca.

descricao: Composer, arranger, instrumentalist, singer and broadcaster. He is the author of many succesful songs, among them Cidade Maravilhosa, hymn of the Rio de Janeiro. He worked with Noel Rosa and Heitor dos Prazeres and his compositions were recorded by the greatest artists of 1930's and 1940's such as Silvio Caldas, Carmen Miranda, Francisco Alves and Mário Reis.

item.texto: His first composition ever recorded was Velho solar on Parlophon performed by Henrique de Melo Morais (Vinícius de Morais' uncle).

Records his first success, the march Cidade maravilhosa with Aurora Miranda who was Carmen Miranda's youger sister. The song won 2nd place in the Carnival that year but it is the favorite song of the public and became the hymn of the Rio de Janeiro by a decree signed in 1960.
Released the march Linda Rosa and the samba Quem mandou?
Cidade maravilhosa becomes officially the hymn of the Rio de Janeiro.
His works now belong to the Instituto Moreira Sales, which paid tribute to the composer on the occasion of his birth centenary with an Exposition including scores, documents and photos.

descricao: Iniciou sua carreira artística tocando piano em sua cidade natal, Muriaé, e em outras cidades de Minas Gerais, como Carangola. Em 1929, transfere-se para o Rio de Janeiro, onde passa a trabalhar em um banco. Na capital, começa a escrever músicas em parceria com grandes nomes como Lamartine Babo, Ary Barroso e Braguinha. Entre seus grandes sucessos estão Canta Brasil (com David Nasser) e Dama das Camélias (com Braguinha).

Author of some of the biggest carnival success such as Touradas em Madri, Pastorinhas, Dama das camélias and Balancê, Braguinha (João de Barro) also contributed with Brazilian MPB composing pieces such as Copacabana.

item.texto: He founded the group Flor do Tempo with some friends like Henrique Brito and Álvaro Ribeiro. The group used to perform in parties and celebrations in Vila Isabel, a neighborhood where Braguinha lived.

He creates the group Bando de Tangarás with Henrique Brito, Álvaro Miranda Ribeiro (Alvinho), Almirante and Noel Rosa. With this group Braguinha starts his professional career and obtain immediate success alongside with Almirante and Noel Rosa. For the first recording together, Braguinha adopted the João de Barro pseudonym with which would become known.
He debuts as a composer with the song Dona Antonha, recorded by Almirante this year for Parlophon Records.
He debuts as a soloist singer performing two songs of Lamartine Babo: Cor de Prata and Minha Cabrocha. However, later he gave up the singer career to devote himself to composition.
Release of the songs Trem Blindado and Moreninha da praia in Almirante's voice for the carnival this year.
He composes new big success for carnival which would become classics: Linda Lourinha and Uma andorinha não faz verão (with Lamartine Babo), recorded by Silvio Caldas and Mário Reis.
He launches his marchinha Deixa a lua sossegada and starts his musical partnership with Alberto Ribeiro.
Composes, in a partnership with Alberto Ribeiro, the big carnival success Touradas em Madri.
This year he holds the position of artistic director of Columbia Records. Composes, with Alcir Pires Vermelho, Dona Rita and Dama das camélias, both recorded by Francisco Alves.
He holds the position of director of Continental label.
Composes, in a partnership with Alberto Ribeiro, the samba Copacabana, huge success in Dick Farney's voice.
Release of the carnival classics Pirata da Perna de Pau, recorded by Nuno Roland, and Andaluzia, in Silvio Caldas' voice.
Release of marchinha Chiquita Bacana.
The marchinha Balancê (composed in a partnership with Alberto Ribeiro), is recorded by singer Gal Costa.
He is honored by the samba school Estação Primeira de Mangueira and participates in carnival parade.

descricao: Born in Almofala, Portugal, came to Rio de Janeiro at the age of 11, where he received his musical training and produced all his works.

item.texto: Born in Portugal, Vicente came to Rio de Janeiro at the age of 11 and received his musical education. In this city he produced his works.
Composes Noturno para violino e piano.
Writes Introdução e Fuga, dedicated to João Arnaldo.
Composes Quarteto de cordas and Concerto para trompete e orquestra.
Composes Abertura Sinfônica, award-winning work in the National Composition Competition Francisco Braga.

descricao: Born in Conceição, Paraíba, moved to Rio de Janeiro as a military musician. Graduated from the National School of Music, composed outstanding works of a resulting nationalism of research material from different regions and Brazilian cultural segments. Among them, there are: Concerto para orquestra, the series Brasilianas, the Toada para orquestra de cordas and the operas A Compadecida and Gimba.

item.texto: Born in Conceição, very early involved himself in the music business. He was sent by his father, alongside with his brother, to the seminar in Triunfo, Pernambuco, which expanded his musical knowledge learning plaichant, hymns and choral singing.
He entered the military service in the current city of João Pessoa, which integrates music band battalion as the first trumpeter.
He leaves the army and goes to Rio de Janeiro where he will improve his musical career.

He finishes his composition studies at the Instituto Nacional de Música, where he had classes with Francisco Braga and Walter Burle-Marx, and also studied solfa, harmony, counterpoint and fugue. In the following year, he becomes a professor in regency and composition at the same institute.
Founded the Brazilian Symphony Orchestra whose goal is to promote symphonic music.
Composes the Carnaval no Recife - a dance suite.
Composes Primeira sinfonia, one of the several orchestral works this year.
At Sorbonne, in Paris, he improved his knowledge in musicology and at the Paris Conservatory he studied composition and regency.

He retires as a professor at the Escola de Música da Universidade Federal do Rio de Janeiro and travel to Europe. He was a founding member of the Brazilian Academy of Music and of the International Artistic Society of Rio de Janeiro.
Composes Terceiro Concerto para violino e orquestra - Paisagem sonora.

obras.titulo: Concerto n.3 para violino e orquestra

item.texto: Composes Leito de folhas verdes, a symphonic poem inspired by Gonçalves Dias works.

obras.titulo: Leito de folhas verdes - poema sinfônico

descricao: Son of musicians, Camargo started his musical studies when he was 10 years old with Virgínio Dias, to whom he dedicated his first composition. He began to compose in a regular basis after the first Modern Art's Week, in 1922. In these compositions Camargo applied a typical Brazilian style. He passed away after receiving the Gabriel Mistral Award from OEA, in Washington, as the best American continent composer.

item.texto: He moves to São Paulo and starts his studies with Ernani Braga.
Starts to study regency, harmony, fugue and orchestration with the Italian regent Lamberto Baldi, until 1930.
Composes Choro n.3 for flute, clarinet, oboe and horn. In this composition he shows a deep link with Brazilian popular music.

obras.titulo: Quatro poemas de Macunaíma: 1 Rudá, Rudá; 2 Antianti é tapejara; 3 Mandu sarará; 4 Sai, aruê
Quatro trovas: 1 Na rua; 2 Pitanga madura; 3 Lua cheia; 4 Natal na roça
Quatro poemas de Macunaíma: 1 Rudá, Rudá; 2 Antianti é tapejara; 3 Mandu sarará; 4 Sai, aruê
Concerto nº 1 para piano e orquestra: Selvagem; Saudosamente; Depressa
Sonata nº 1 para violoncelo e piano: Tristonho; Apaixonadamente; Selvagem
Trio para violino, viola e violoncelo: Enérgico e ritmado; Sorumbático; Com alegria
Concerto nº 1 para piano e orquestra: Selvagem; Saudosamente; Depressa
Ponteios nº 1: Calmo e com profunda saudade

item.texto: Became regent and director of the Paulistano Choir which emphasis used to be performance works of Brazilian composers with texts in Portuguese, that were rare at the time.
After receiving a trip to Europe as a prize from the Counselor of Artistic Orientation from São Paulo, he goes to Paris, where enhanced his knowledge about music.
Starts as supervisor regent of the Orquestra Municipal de São Paulo.

obras.titulo: Foi o vento... foi a vida

item.texto: Begins his activities as assistant of Education and Culture Minister, Clóvis Salgado, and elaborates a general plan for the music's teaching in Brazil.

obras.titulo: Quatro cantigas: 1 A cantiga da mutuca (08/07/1949; 2’); 2 Cantiga (21/01/1955; 2’); 3 Não sei... (19/12/1956; 2’); 4 Vamos dar a despedida (18/12/1956; 2’)
Sonata nº 4 para violino e piano: Energico e espressivo; Íntimo; Allegro appassionato
Choro para clarineta e orquestra: Lento e nostálgico; Moderato; Lento; Allegro
Choro para piano e orquestra: Cômodo; Nostálgico; Alegre

item.texto: Composes the opera Um homem só.

obras.titulo: Um homem só (tragédia lírica em um ato)
Improvisos nº 2: Lentamente – Homenagem a Villa-Lobos

item.texto: Became regent and artistic director of the Orquestra Sinfônica da Universidade de São Paulo (Symphony Orchestra of University of São Paulo), position that occuped until 1992.

obras.titulo: Choro para viola e orquestra: Enérgico; Tristemente; Bem ritmado
Poemas da negra: 8 Nega em teu ser primário
Poemas da negra: 9 Na Zona da Mata
Poemas da negra: 10 Há o mutismo exaltado dos astros (1975)
Poemas da negra: 11 Ai, momentos de físico amor

descricao: Singer, composer and radio host, his career began in group Bando de Tangarás with Noel Rosa and Braguinha. He was creator of several successful radio programs and also composer of Na Pavuna, a blockbuster samba composed in 1929.

Cartola composed classic sambas such as As rosas não falam and O mundo é um moinho, and was one of the founders of Samba School Estação Primeira de Mangueira. Despite having his songs recorded since 1930s by singers such as Francisco Alves and Carmen Miranda, he only became popular at the end of his life. He is one of the greatest samba composers.

item.texto: Born in Rio de Janeiro in the area known as Catete, he moved with his family at the age of 11 to Morro da Mangueira where he lived most of his life.
Cartola and his friend Carlos Cachaça founded the group Bloco dos Arengueiros in Mangueira.

He founds with other musicians the G. R. E. S. Estação Primeira de Mangueira, one of the most traditional and best supported Samba School in Rio de Janeiro. He was reponsible for choosing the iconic pink and green as its official colours.
He sells to Mário Reis the publishing rights of the samba Que Infeliz Sorte, which ends up being recorded by Francisco Alves.
His samba Tenho um novo amor is recorded by Carmen Miranda.
Composes the first samba in partnership with Carlos Cachaça: Pudesse meu ideal, samba that led Mangueira to win the 1933 Carnival Championship.
Composes the samba Não quero mais with Carlos Cachaça and Zé da Zilda, which was recorded the following year by Aracy de Almeida.

obras.titulo: Não Quero Mais Amar A Ninguém

item.texto: He participates with Pixinguinha, Jararaca and Luiz Americano, among others, in the recordings promoted by conductor Leopoldo Stokowsky in Rio de Janeiro. The recordings would later be released in the USA by Columbia company.
Together with Paulo da Portela and Heitor dos Prazeres creates the group Conjunto Carioca, performing a series of programs for Radio Cosmos in São Paulo.
Mangueira wins the Carnival Championship with another partnership between Cartola and Carlos Cachaça: O Vale do S. Francisco.
After a long time away from the art scene, Cartola is "rediscovery" by journalist Sérgio Porto working as a car-washer in Ipanema, Rio de Janeiro.
Cartola was already married to Eusébia Silva do Nascimento, Dona Zica, when they opened at Rua da Carioca the restaurant Zicartola. The place became a meeting point for intellectuals and sambistas.
Records his first solo album with Marcus Pereira Records. The album received numerous awards and established him as a successful composer.
Releases his second album with Marcus Pereira featuring the classic As rosas não falam.

descricao: Born to a family of musicians, he began his musical studies at 8 years old. He perfected his violin and composition skills at the Conservatory of Cincinnati, USA. His orchestral repertoire Salamanca do Jaraú was performed by the Orchestra of the Municipal Theater, under the direction of Villa-Lobos. Beginning in 1951, an illness prevent him from composing, but he was still able to publish texts of a musical nature such as Intro­dução à música, Música e tempo and Música sempre música.

item.texto: Born in Porto Alegre, Rio Grande do Sul, to a family of musicians, he began his musical studies at 8 years old. He devoted himself to the violin and studied harmony at the Conservatory of Porto Alegre.

Travelled to the United States where he attended the Conservatory of Cincinnati for two years, improving in violin and composition. On his return to Brazil, he dedicated himself to teaching at the Musical Institute and the American College of Porto Alegre.

Travelled to Rio de Janeiro, where he later created his orchestral repertoire Salamanca do Jaraú - originally a ballet - performed by the Orchestra of the Municipal Theatre and conducted by Villa-Lobos.
His stand-out works for the orchestra still include Prelúdio and the ballet Lambe-Lambe, the latter composed this year.

An illness stops him from composing, but he still manages to publish musical texts such as Intro­dução à música, Música e tempo and Música sempre música. He was also a founding member of the Brazilian Academy of Music (seat n.8).

descricao: As a child he learnt to play many instruments from his father. He studied at Escola Paulista de Canto Orfeônico in São Paulo. He composed 25 sound tracks for films by the cinematographer Amácio Mazzaropi. His compositions were recorded by artists such as Almir Sater and Renato Teixeira, among others. His works include country music, marches, sambas and walzes.

item.texto: In partnership with Patativa and Anacleto Rosa Jr., Elpídio recorded his first song, A cruz de ferro.
His song Despertar do sertão was launched by the recording company Toda América, sung by Cascatinha and Inhana. This was the first Brazilian song to be played on the BBC Radio in London.

His song A dor da saudade had enormous success as the sound track from the film "Casinha Pequenina", by Amácio Mazzaropi. In collaboration with his friend cinematographer, Elpídio composed 25 songs for 19 Mazzaropi's films.

Elpídio dos Santos died in his home town. Sometime later, his children and his widow Dona Cinira created the Instituto Elpídio dos Santos. Nowadays the entire phonographic archive and his repertory of more than 1000 songs are catalogued and preserved there.

In the 2nd half of the 70's decade, four of his seven children joined together to form the band Grupo Paranga with the goal to save and promote the repertory left by Elpídio in a revamped style. At the beginning of the 80's playing violas, guitars, cavaquinho (small guitar) and percussion with vocals the "Big Band Caipira", as it was called, broke into the movement known as Vanguarda Paulistana.

In honour of the centenary of his birth a tribute album was launched "Tributo a Elpídio dos Santos", with songs interpreted by the Grupo Paranga. The group originally formed by his children had promoted his works and regional music for more than 20 years.

descricao: Born in Vila Isabel, a place he praised in several sambas, Noel Rosa had a very short life period, dying at the age of 26, and yet his musical production was quite vast: he left more than 200 sambas, among which classical titles such as Feitiço da Vila, Conversa de Botequim and Pastorinhas. He was the first to bridge the gap between the favelas and the city.

item.texto: Having been educated by his mother, Noel enters Maisonnette School at the age of 13, followed by São Bento School. During this time he learns to play mandolin, which would soon be replaced by acoustic guitar.

After finishing his high-school studies at São Bento School, Noel starts studying to become a doctor, but he quits Medicine for his musical career. In the same year joins João de Barro Almirante, Alvinho and Henrique Brito, who were musicians from the same neighbourhood, and formed the musical group Bando de Tangarás.

Inspired by the northeastern Brazilian music, very popular at the time, he writes and records in 78 rpm (Parlophone) his two first works: the embolada Minha Viola and the toada Festa no Céu. In the same year the samba Com que roupa is released, giving him great popularity.

Release of the sambas Cordiais saudações and Mulata fuzarqueira. Noel starts working as assistant in Programa Casé, at Phillips Radio. He also presents himself as singer alongside Almirante and João de Barro, big names of Brazilian music.
Goes on tour to south Brazil with Mário Reis and Lamartine Babo. His partnership with Ismael Silva becomes stronger with the release of the sambas Adeus and Para me livrar do mal.

obras.titulo: A razão dá-se a quem tem

item.titulo: A razão dá-se a quem tem

item.texto: This is the most productive year of his career. Noel records 30 new songs, among which are classics such as Feitio de Oração and Feitiço da Vila (with Vadico), Até amanhã, Fita amarela, Três apitos, among others.
Meets Ceci, dancer at the cabaret in Lapa. She would be the love of his life, inspiring sambas like Pra que mentir and Cem mil réis (both with Vadico), Dama do Cabaré, Último desejo, among others.

With both of his lungs affected by the tuberculosis, Noel travels to Belo Horizonte in order to recover his health. However, with the death of his father in same year, he must return to Rio de Janeiro. Here writes the classic Palpite Infeliz.
The songs Pierrô Apaixonado and Não resta a menor dúvida (with Hervê Cordovil), are part of the soundtrack of the film Alô, Alô Carnaval, by Ademar Gonzaga.

Composes the sambas Último Desejo and Eu sei sofrer, which would be his last work. Looking for environments more suitable for his condition, Noel travels to Nova Friburgo and Barra do Piraí. There he finds no relieve, returning to Rio de Janeiro, where dies in May 4th, in Vila Isabel, at the age of 26.

descricao: Composer. Singer. Comedian. Actor. A child of Italian immigrants, João Rubinato was the son of Ferdinando and Emma Rubinato. In the history of Música Popular Brasileira (MPB or Popular Brazilian Music), he is one of the most prominent names in São Paulo culture and artistic production, a highly original musical chronicler of life in his native city.

item.texto: After trying his luck on talent shows at Rádio Cruzeiro do Sul in São Paulo, he earns a spot on Jorge Amaral's show.

His first composition, the march Dona boa, is recorded by Raul Torres on the Columbia label. It wins first prize in the City of São Paulo's carnival song contest. From 1935 to 1940, he works at Rádio Cruzeiro do Sul as a singer and host of record programs.

Introduced by Otávio Gabus Mendes, he moves to Rádio Record, where he works in radio theater in a series named Serões Domingueiros. Also working at the station at the time is Osvaldo Moles, who is responsible for creating various characters with a typically popular style of speaking, characters tha would profoundly influence Barbosa's work in subsequent years.
The group Demônios da Garoa is formed and he begins to perform with them.

His samba Malvina wins first prize in São Paulo's carnival competition. It is recorded by Demônios da Garoa and released for carnival the following year. In the 1950s, Demônios da Garoa are Adoniran's most consistent interpreters.

Samba do Arnesto, co-written with Alocin, and the samba Conselho de mulher, co-written with José B. Santos and Osvaldo Moles, are recorded. In the same year, he composes the samba Joga a chave with Osvaldo França, which wins first prize in São Paulo's carnival competition and is recorded by Demônios da Garoa.

Demônios da Garoa's recording Saudosa Maloca and Samba do Arnesto affirms the unique style that made Adoniran famous as the most faithful chronicler of São Paulo's popular classes, portraying a language resulting from the melding of different immigrant groups.

The samba Iracema, another of ihs big success, is recorded by Demônios da Garoa on the Odeon label. The group also records the sambas Um samba no Bixiga, Quem bate sou eu, co-written with Artur Bernardo, and Apaga o fogo mané.

Release of Bom dia tristeza, a one-time collaboration with the poet Vinicius de Moraes. Vinicius's first draft is initially delivered to Adoniran by the singer Aracy de Almeida, who records is shortly after.

In collaboration with Osvaldo Moles, composes the samba Tiro ao Álvaro, which he later records with Elis Regina. Inspired by the samba Saudosa maloca, Osvaldo Moles writes a part especially for him for the program História das malocas, in which he plays the character Charutinho. História das malocas runs until 1965.

Chantecler lable releases for the first time the samba Trem das onze by Adoniran Barbosa, his big success. The samba would become an anthem of São Paulo and it is one of the greatest success of Brazilian music.
Release of his first solo LP, featuring old and new compositions. A year later, he releases the LP "Adoniran Barbosa".

nome: Anônimo, obras compiladas por Mario de Andrade
nome_completo: Anônimo, obras compiladas por Mario de Andrade
descricao:
"Bouquet of 15 precious modinhas of the Brazilian Empire time, for voice and piano, followed by delicate Lundu for pianoforte, carefully chosen, prefaced, annotated, and dedicated to his illustrious and brilliant friend, maestro Heitor Villa-Lobos, by Mario de Andrade "
 

	Dedicatory text in edition Casa Chiarato, São Paulo, 1930.

Pianist, composer, conductor, teacher. In addition to the songs and numerous works for choir, gave great contribution to the Brazilian chamber music, emphasizing the string quartets, sonatas for cello and piano, and for violin and piano. Also noteworthy are the opera Máscaras and the Fantasia that goes into musical concert, for piano and orchestra.

item.texto: Born in Cumbuquira, Minas Gerais, moved to Rio de Janeiro at the age of seven.
Concludes the theory and solfege courses, counterpoint and fugue and piano at the National Institute of Music, obtaining the piano's 1st Prize.

Begins his close collaborative relationship with Villa-Lobos, when he has been in the United States debuting the Bachianas n.3 for piano and orchestra. The following year, was nominated professor at the National Conservatory of Orpheonic Singing and, thereafter, no longer stopped to teaching choral singing.
Founded the Madrigal Vox, acting as regent of this choir until 1945, having also been dedicated to several other chorals at the Brazilian Conservatory of Music.
Holds the position of professor (Livre-Docente) at the Music School of Federal University of Rio de Janeiro.
Performs the thecnical function in musical and aristic education at the Secretariat of Education and Culture of Rio de Janeiro until 1967.
Composes Fantasia Concertante para piano e orquestra, dedicated to Eunice.

obras.titulo: Fantasia concertante para piano e orquestra

item.texto: Composes Quarteto n.2 para cordas.

descricao: Known as the Baião King or Gonzagão, he took up the sanfona after bein encouraged by his father, who repaired accordions and played at "forró" parties. A trumpet player in the Fortaleza Army, he was transferred to Minas Gerais, where he began to study music theory. He is the creator of the rhytnm known as "baião", which he immortalized.

item.texto: After abandoning his repertoire of foreign rhythms and becoming a big hit singing the well loved Vira e mexe in Ari Barroso's amateur music contest on Radio Nacional, he begins participating in various radio programmes. He is hired by Rádio Clube do Brasil, followed by Rádio Tamoio.

At Radio Nacional he meets his first musical partner, Miguel Lima, who writes the lyrics for Vira e mexe and transforms it into Chamego, a song that becomes a big success when recorded by Carmen Costa.
He makes his first recording as a singer with the song Dança, Mariquinha, and forms a musical partnership with Humberto Teixeira, whith whom he creates a new rhythm, style and musical genre: baião.
He marries Helena das Neves.
With Humberto Teixeira, he releases another hit, Mangaratiba.
In collaboration with Humberto Teixeira, Emilinha Borba and Os Cariocas, he immortalizes baião rhythm.

With Humberto Teixeira, he releases the songs Paraíba and Baião de dois. Gonzaga begins composing exclusively with José de Souza Dantas Filho, a medical student. With Zé Dantas, he releases Cintura fina and A volta da asa branca.
He launches ABC do sertão, Algodão, Vozes da seca and Paulo Afonso. He takes part on the show No Mundo do Baião on Rádio Nacional, alongside with Paulo Roberto and Zé Dantas.

His popularity is enormous and baião rhythm enjoys its golden age until 1954, when bossa-nova's climb in popularity. Baião becomes forgotten in the major centres. Removed from scene, Gonzaga focuses on performing in small cities where he continues to enjoy great popularity.
He starts composing with new partners such as Hervé Cordovil and João Silva, after Zé Dantas' death.
Geraldo Vandré records his song Asa branca, and Gilberto Gil, just beginning his career, cites Gonzaga as one of his main influences.

He launches the LP "O canto jovem de Luíz Gonzaga" on RCA, featuring compositions by Gilberto Gil, Caetano Veloso, Edu Lobo, Dorival Caymmi, Geraldo Vandré and others. Caetano Veloso records Asa branca.
He participates in the show "Trinta anos de baião" at Teatro Municipal de São Paulo, with the friends Carmélia Alves, Hervé Cordovil and Humberto Teixeira.
The LP "Eu e meu pai" is released for RCA, in honor to his father who passed away in 1978.
He forms a partnership with his son, the singer and composer Gonzaguinha. Finds success again while touring with his LP "A vida do viajante", in which he earns the nickname Gonzagão.
Invited by Nazaré Pereira, a Brazilian singer who had resettled in France, he gives his European debut performance at théatre Bobino, in Paris.
He earns his first gold disc with "Danado de bom". Most of the songs were composed in a partnership with João Silva. He wins the Shell Prize.

Gonzaga returns to Paris to performing in Brazilian music festival Couleurs Brésil. The book "Luíz Gonzaga, o rei do baião – sua vida, seus amigos, suas canções", by José J. Ferreira, is released this year.

descricao: Pianist, composer and folklorist, Aloysio de Alencar Pinto composed works for piano, voice and piano, choral singing, chamber music and for orchestra, in addition to incidental music for the theatre and cinema. He was honored with the Medal of the City of Paris and the Ruy Barbosa Medal from Fundação Casa de Ruy Barbosa. He took part of the Brazilian Academy of Music, where he held the chair of Ernesto Nazareth.

item.texto: Completed the piano studies course with a gold medal at the National Institute of Music, where he was student of  Godofredo Leão Velloso and Barrozo Netto.

Travelling to study in France, he received the Mention d’Honneur de Virtuosité, the highest honour by Conservatoire Américain au Palais de Fontainebleau to a musician. This same award had been granted to the great North-American composer Aaron Copland a few years earlier.
He worked as Orson Wells's advisor on musical affairs when Wells filmed in Fortaleza scenes for the unfinished film It's all true.

descricao: Eleazar de Carvalho was one of the most important Brazilian conductors. He moved to Rio de Janeiro at young age, playing tuba in Banda do Batalhão Naval (a military band). Eleazar conducted the main orchestras af the world. He was professor at Yale University and artistic director of the Festival of Campos do Jordão.

item.texto: While finishing his course, composed an opera O Descobrimento do Brasil that was shown for the first time in the Municipal Theater of Rio de Janeiro.
Travelled to the United States where he trained with Koussevitzky and became his assistent.

Conducted the Boston Symphony Orchestra, winning the local audience not only by his deep knowledge of Berlioz's Symphonie Fantastique, and later of symphonies of Mahler and Beethoven, but for his natural and sincere musical conception.
He debuted in Europe, in Palais des Beaux-Arts in Brussels.
Accepted the position of conductor in Berkshire Music Center. He was working there, next to Leonard Bernstein, for 16 years.

Assumed the musical coordination of the Winter Festival of Campos do Jordão and continued it until his death. Eleazar de Carvalho is always remembered during the festival that takes place every July until today.

descricao: A composer, diplomat and poet, his name is indelibly tied to bossa nova: after all, he penned the genre's classic lyrics, including Chega de Saudade, Garota de Ipanema and Eu sei que vou te amar. He had various collaborators across all types of popular music: Chico Buarque, Edu Lobo, Baden Powell, Toquinho and Pixinguinha, among others. As a writer, he left more than 15 published works.

item.texto: In his final year of junior high studies at Colégio Santo Inácio in Botafogo, he meets the brothers Paulo and Haroldo Tapajós. The following year, he composes the foxtrot Loura ou Morena with Haroldo, which is recorded by the two brothers in 1932.
Enrols at the Faculty of Law in Catete. There, he meets the novelist Otávio de Faria, who encourages him to pursue a literary career.

Completes his studies at the Faculty of Law and publishes his first book of poems, O caminho para a distância, for which he receives critical recognition from intellectuals such as Manuel Bandeira and Mário de Andrade. By this time, 10 of his songs have been recorded, most of them in collaoration with Haroldo Tapajós.

Takes the public service exams and is summoned to the Ministry of External Relations, where he works as a diplomat until 1968. That year, he is forced into mandatory retirement by Institutional Act No.5
Takes up his first diplomatic post as vice consul in Los Angeles. Publishes the book Poemas, sonetos e baladas.
Composes his first samba in collaboration with Antonio Maria: Quando tu passas por mim. Moves to Paris to work as second secretary at the Brazilian Embassy.

His play Orfeu da Conceição debuts at the Teatro Municipal do Rio de Janeiro. The play marks the beginning of his musical partnership with Tom Jobim, with whom he would go on to compose such classics as Chega de saudade and Garota de Ipanema.

obras.titulo: Se todos fossem iguais a você

item.texto: Release of the LP Canção do amor demais, comprised solely of songs co-written with Tom Jobim and interpreted by the singer Elizeth Cardoso. The LP is later considered to be one of the markers of bossa nova's establishment.
Meets the guitarist and composer Carlos Lyra, who becomes a collaborator on such classics as Minha namorada, Marcha da quarta-feira de cinzas and Coisa mais linda, among others.

obras.titulo: Marcha da quarta feira de cinzas

item.texto: Meets the guitarist and composer Baden Powell, with whom he would go on to compose such hits as Deixa, Canto de Ossanha, Samba da bênção, Apelo and Berimbau, among others.

Beginning of a partnership with Edu Lobo, with whom he would go on to compose Arrastão (the winning song at the 1st Festival of Popular Brazilian Music, hosted by TV Excelsior in 1965), Zambi and Canção do amanhecer, among others.
Becomes a partner of Toquinho, with whom he would go on to launch such hits as Tarde em Itapoã and Regra Três, among others.
On 9 July, dies of pulmonary edema in his house in Gávea (Rio de Janeiro).

descricao: Composer and singer who made Bahia internationally famous (for songs such as O que é que a baiana tem, A preta do acarajé among others), Caymmi had an influence on various generations of Brazilian artists. He moved to Rio de Janeiro at the end of the 1930s, where he spent time working actively as a singer and a composer in an environment of radio and records.

item.texto: Composes No sertão, his first composition.
Encouraged by radio presenter Gilberto Martins, he debuted at Radio Clube in Bahia with the program Caymmi e suas Canções Praieiras.
Won a carnival song contest in Salvador with the song A Bahia também dá and received the prize - a satin lampshade.
Records by Odeon (in duet with Carmen Miranda) his songs O que é que a baiana tem? and A preta do acarajé.
The group Anjos do Inferno releases the songs Você já foi a Bahia?, Requebre que eu dou um doce, Vatapá and Rosa Morena.

obras.titulo: Requebre que eu dou um doce

item.texto: Recording of the samba-frevo Dora, performed by the author himself at Odeon Records.

Release of the samba-canção Marina, on a record by Dick Farney. Marina was one of Caymmi's major success, opening a new phase in the composer's career, now characterized by sorrowful sambas with urban themes.
Release of the samba-canção Nunca mais, on a recording by singer Lúcio Alves.
Release of the samba songs Não tem solução and Sábado em Copacabana, both in collaboration with Carlos Guinle.
Release of LP Canções Praieiras.
Released the samba Maracangalha, great success of the carnival that year.
He releases by Odeon the LP Caymmi e seu violão.

Performs with Vinícius de Morais and Quarteto em Cy at the nightclub Zum-zum in Rio de Janeiro. On this occasion he released the samba Adalgisa and the valsa-samba Das rosas. He also released the LP Caymmi visita Tom, album designed by Aloysio de Oliveira.
He took part in a show at the Teatro Ópera in Buenos Aires with Vinícius de Morais and Baden Powell.
Releases the LP Caymmi também é do rancho.
Composes Modinha para Gabriela the theme for a soup-opera on TV Globo. The song was recorded by the singer Gal Costa.
Releases the LP Dori, Nana, Danilo e Dorival Caymmi with EMI.
Releases the album Caymmi em família with Som Livre.

descricao: With an extremely critical eye toward his own work as much as to everything that was happening around him and participating in the most important cultural movements of his time, Guerra-Peixe leaves an important artistic legacy, not only for his beautiful and inspired compositions, but also for his accomplishments as a researcher, teacher and essayist.

item.texto: At age seven he was already playing guitar, violin and piano by ear and taking part in the Choro ensembles that went through the streets of his hometown during Carnival.

Began his musical studies at the Escola de Música Santa Cecília, in Petrópolis, Rio de Janeiro, to study solfege with Henry Harry, piano with Adelaide Carneiro and Elfrida Strattman and violin with Gáo Omacht for five years.
At the end of two years of study at the Escola de Música Santa Cecília, receives a gold medal as an award in recognition of his improvement in his violin course.
His first job as a violinist is working in silent film sessions at Cine Glória, in Petrópolis, Rio de Janeiro.
Completes the course of music theory and solfege with Deoclécio Damasceno de Freitas and is named adjunct professor of violin at the Escola de Música Santa Cecília.
Becomes professor of violin at the Escola de Música Santa Cecília. Begins studying violin with Lionel Maul.

Takes provate violin courses with teacher Paulina d’Ambrosio, in Rio de Janeiro. Meets Ronaldo Lupo, who introduces him to Saint-Clair Senna, flutist and composer whose works are his first recorded arrangements, recorded by Gastão Formenti.

Earns the highest marks on the entrance examination to study violin at the Instituto Nacional de Música do Rio de Janeiro (currently Escola de Música da Universidade Federal do Rio de Janeiro) where continues his studies with Paulina d’Ambrósio and begins the elementary harmony course with Arnaud Gouvêa and chamber ensemble with Orlando Frederico.

Takes up residence in Rio de Janeiro, where works substituting for musicians in restaurants and dance halls. He could perform any song without reading the score, a fact that favored his work in public housing. Graduates in violin from the Escola de Música da Universidade Federal do Rio de Janeiro.
Plays on Rádio Clube do Brasil and in the orchestra of Vicente Paiva, who recommends him to work as a violinist in the orchestra of Cassino Icaraí.

Resumes studying harmony and begins studying counterpoint with Newton Pádua at the Conservatório Brasileiro de Música in Rio de Janeiro. Works in the Theatrical Company Alda Garrido at the Teatro Carlos Gomes in Rio de Janeiro and in other cities.

Leads an orchestra for the first time in his film debut, O dia é nosso. At the Conservatório Brasileiro de Música, he becomes the first Brazilian graduated in fugue and counterpoint along with the standardas of the Paris Conservatoire after a ten and half hour exam done in ink and without drafts.
Composes the march Fibra de Herói, popularized as Bandeira do Brasil due to its first verse, with Teóphilo de Barros Filho's lyrics.

Debuts the program Instantâneos Sinfônicos Schenley, directed by Olavo de Barros and under general direction of Teóphilo Barros Filho, which lasts until 1945. Guerra-Peixe has to compose nearly an hour of orchestral music every two days. Graduates from the Conservatório Brasileiro de Música in instrumentations and composition with Newton Pádua.

He begins its twelve-tone phase and attends for two and a half years the private course of Koellreutter. He joined the group Música Viva, playing at Rádio MEC in Rio de Janeiro. Dedicated more and more to the orchestration he composes the Sinfonia n.1.

obras.titulo: Três peças para fagote e piano

item.texto: Puts a personal touch in utilizing the twelve-tone system while composing Música n. 1 for piano and Trio de cordas.

obras.titulo: Trio para violino, viola e violoncelo

item.texto: Composes his Miniaturas n.1 and n.2. The composition Divertissement n. 2 runs on BBC Americas program and is performed by New London String Ensemble and directed by Maurice Milles

obras.titulo: Miniaturas n.1 para violino e piano

item.texto: Hermann Scherchen performs Noneto on Radio Zurich and includes it in his repertoire by performing it in several countries such as Germany, Austria and Italy.
While traveling to Recife, composes Suíte para quarteto ou orquestra de cordas inspirada num pregão de cocada, with movements of Maracatu, Pregão, Modinha and Frevo.
Unanimously wins first place with the symphonic work Abertura Solene in a competition held by the municipal government of Recife to celebrate the 100th anniversary of the Teatro Santa Isabel.

Receives the Sylvio Romero Medal from the municipal government of thefederal District of Rio de Janeiro. Participates in the sonata competition for violin and piano, organized for the 1st Biennal of the São Paulo Museum of Modern Art. Receives a scholarship to study at the IV Curso Internacional de Férias de Teresópolis due to the good performance in the competition.

obras.titulo: Sonata n.1 para violino e piano

item.texto: The composition Sonata para violino e piano is awarded at the São Paulo Museum of Modern Art.
Participates in the São Paulo's Folk Comission and presents his thesis about zabumba in 2nd Congresso Brasileiro de Folclore.

His soundtrack for the film O canto do mar is prized with the Prêmio Governo do Estado de São Paulo, the Prêmio Saci, in Rio de Janeiro, and receives good comments from specialists in London, Vienna, Praghe and other European cities.
Publishes his book Maracatus do Recife edited by Ricordi Brasileira, in São Paulo, a 179 pages folkloric essay with rare musical documentation.
Begins the program Quando os maestros se encontram, on the Radio Nacional, in São Paulo. Composes his orchestral work A inúbia do caboclinho.
Suíte Sinfônica n°1 – Paulista e Ponteado is recorded by the Moscow Orchestra conducted by Edoardo de Guarnieri, releases in Brazil by the label RGE.

obras.titulo: Três peças para viola e piano
Três peças para violino e piano
Três peças para violoncelo e piano

item.texto: Begins to teach at the Escola de Música Villa-Lobos. Does the musical direction of the film Briga, mulher e samba, directed by Sanin Cherques of Lupofilmes.
Records for Radio MEC his Suíte Sinfônica nº 2 - Pernambucana, Ponteado and Suíte para cordas, conducting the National Symphonic Orchestra.
Receives the award Melhores do Ano from the Sociedade Brasileira de Críticos Teatrais and from Radio Jornal do Brasil – JB, for his Sinfonia Brasília.
Receives the medal Carlos Gomes from the government of the state of Guanabara, in recognition of his work for the development of national artistic culture.
Does the arrangements for the celebrated record Afro-sambas, by Vinícius de Moraes and Baden Powell and produced by Marcos Pereira.
Composes the soundtrack for the film Meu nome é Lampião, directed by Mozael Silveira, of Cinematográficas R. F. Farias.
Does the musical arrangement of Miguel Gustavo's Pra Frente Brasil for the 1970 FIFA World Cup in Mexico.

obras.titulo: Dueto Característico para violino e violão
Dueto Característico para violino e acordeão

item.texto: Was elected to the Academia Brasileira de Música, chair nº 34, in the spot of his former teacher Newton Pádua. Composes the orchestral work A Retirada de Laguna.

Receives first place in the Concurso do Sesquicentenário da Independência do Brasil, from Departamento de Cultura do Estado da Guanabara for the composition Museu da Inconfidência. Writes the Concertino para violino e orquestra de câmara, dedicated to Cussy de Almeida and Orquestra Armorial de Câmara de Pernambuco.

obras.titulo: Concertino para violino e orquestra de câmara

item.texto: Receives the prize in 2nd Concurso Nacional de Composição do Estado da Guanabara, from Conselho Estadual de Cultura, by his composition Micro-concerto – Instantâneos Sinfônicos nº 2, for violin and orchestra.
Participates in the 1st Bienal da Música Brasileira Contemporânea, in Rio de Janeiro.

Does the radio program Brasiliana about brazilian concert music for Radio Nacional do Rio de Janeiro untl 1978. Receives the prize o IX Festival de Brasília do Cinema Brasileiro for the soundtrack of the film Soledade.
Composes Roda de amigos for chamber orchestra, dedicated to his friend Nelson de Macêdo.

obras.titulo: Roda de amigos para orquestra de câmara

item.texto: Is a teacher of composition and orchestration at the Escola de Música Villa-Lobos, until 1993.
Receives the third prize Golfinho de Ouro, from Museu da Imagem e do Som, in Rio de Janeiro.
Receives the Prêmio Shell with the first full execution of Sinfonia nº 2 Brasília, including the speech by Juscelino Kubitschek.

Makes his last television appearance and conducts an orchestra for the last time on the program Os Arranjadores on TV Cultura de São Paulo with the moving presentation of his symphonic arrangement for Cantos Afro-Brasileiros of Baden Powell and Vinícius de Moraes. During this time, he composes Tributo à Portinari.

César Guerra-Peixe passes away in Rio de Janeiro, leaving us one of the most important musical legacies through his intense work not only as a composer but also as a musician, essayist and cultural sponsor.

Receives the Prêmio Nacional de Música from Ministério da Cultura at the Theatro Municipal do Rio de Janeiro at the premiere of the composition Tributo a Portinari, during the 10th Bienal de Música Brasileira Contemporânea, performed by Orquestra Sinfônica Brasileira conducted by Mario Tavares.

descricao: Cacilda Borges Barbosa was a student of Francisco Braga who belonged to a long lineage of composers. She has also worked with Villa-Lobos from the 1930's, assuming the role of director of Rio de Janeiro's Music Service founded by him. Despite her final Regency's examiners having found her too short to conduct an orchestra, she has proved them wrong by conducting once a choir of over 30 thousand voices. Adding up to her career as a composer and conductor, Cacilda was also a dedicated music professor with published didactic literature as "Educação musical através do teclado" (in authorship with Maria de Lourdes Junqueira Gonçalves), "Estudos de ritmo e som" and "Diorama"- the latter with 50 preparatory studies for piano.

item.texto: Enters the National Institute of Music in Rio de Janeiro, where she would learn from her professors Lorenzo Fernandez, Francisco Braga and Francisco Mignone, among others.
Publishes the first volume of the series Estudos Brasileiros para Canto. Iniciates her activities as a conductor of the Rádio Mayrink Veiga's orchestra.
Composes Concerto para trombone e piano.
Conducts the 30 thousand voices choir from the public schools of Rio de Janeiro during the festivities of Semana da Pátria (Nations Week).
Composes Trio para trombones.
Composes Tríptico, a 4 voices fugue.
Writes Diorama, a didact work of literature with 50 studies for piano based on Brazilian rhytms and including preparatory studies for her another work Estudos Brasileiros para Piano.

descricao: Koeelreutter arrived in Brazil in 1937, having great influence in the country's musical life, where he introduced the dodecaphonism. This technique has taken the place of old procedures used in composition that time. He has mentored several composers and musicians, such as Cláudio Santoro, Guerra-Peixe, Edino Krieger and Tom Jobim, among others.

Começou a tocar clarinete em sua cidade natal, aos doze anos de idade. Mudou-se para São Paulo em 1935. Em 1942, estreou em disco na gravadora Columbia interpretando no clarinete "Chorando baixinho", seu grande sucesso. Em 1954, gravou o LP "Jantar dançante", que trazia o choro "Sai da frente", de sua autoria. Na década de 1970, acompanhou diversos cantores e músicos em gravações e shows.

He was the creator, with Luperce Miranda, of a Brazilian school of mandolin. Jacob started his career at the end of 1940's and for all his life he has excelled as one of the most important choro composers in Brazil. As an instrumentalist of rare perfection, he bequeathed a vast repertoire recorded in many albums, product of his tireless work as a music researcher.

item.texto: Still as an amateur, he performs for the first time at Radio Guanabara.
He wins the first place at "Programa dos Novos",  a contest sponsored by Radio Guanabara. Due his big success, he signs a contract to work on the radio.
Jacob releases his first album 78 rpm by Continental label with songs such as Treme-treme (his own authorship) and Glória (by B. de Oliveira).
He is hired by RCA Victor, where he remained until the end of his career. There he recorded 52 albums 78 rpm and 12 LPs.

Two successful choros are released - Bole bole and Doce de coco -, both recorded on RCA Victor. The second one had two different lyrics written later: one, written by João Pacífico, was recorded by singer Isaura Garcia in 1954; the second one, by Hermínio Bello de Carvalho, was recorded in 1981 by Elizeth Cardoso.
He is invited by TV Record to organize an event with greatest artists of choro that time - "Noite dos Choristas".

He releases LP “Chorinhos e chorões” with RCA Victor, the first album in which he plays with band "Época de Ouro", one of the most representative choro's band. That time, the band was formed by Dino 7 Cordas, César Faria, Carlinhos Leite, Jonas Pereira da Silva, Luís Marinho and Gilberto D’Ávila.
He records Suíte Retratos for mandolin, band and string orchestra, by Radamés Gnatalli. Radamés dedicated the composition to Jacob.
Jacob participated in the show together with Elizeth Cardoso and Zimbo Trio at João Caetano Theater. A LP version of the show, live recorded, has later been released.

descricao: At 5 years old he was already playing piano at festivals. He moved to Rio de Janeiro, where served as music director of the radio stations Mayrink Veiga and Mundial. Was conductor of important Brazilian orchestras, such as Orquestra Sinfônica Brasileira, Theatro Municipal do Rio de Janeiro, the Radio MEC chamber orchestra, besides governing and orchestrating for various other radio and television orchestras.

item.texto: Was born in Curitiba, in the state of Paraná, and at 5 years old he was already playing piano at art festivals.
Composes the work Fantasia for orchestra.
Composes the work Bailado do trigo, also for orchestra.

After his work as piano's teacher at the Escola de Música e Belas Artes do Paraná and of voice physiology at the Conservatório de Santos, he moved to Rio de Janeiro where he served as music director of the radio stations Mayrink Veiga and Mundial.
Was conductor of the first posthumous symphonic concert of Villa-Lobos' work, as well as at a festival in which he gave the first performance of Villa-Lobos' Concerto nº 5.

Travels to Europe to serve as conductor of the Orquestra Sinfônica Brasileira. Was also conductor of the Theatro Municipal do Rio de Janeiro orchestra and the Orquestra de Câmara da Rádio MEC, besides governing and orchestrating for various other radio and television orchestras.
Composes the symphony Um poema para a Lapa.

descricao: Born in Portugal, Adelino and his family came to Campo Grande, Brazil. He debut as a singer at Rádio Clube do Brasil. In Portugal, he recorded many Brazilian songs and when he came back to Brazil, he started to compose. His sambas Meu vício é você and A volta do boêmio were big hits recorded by singer Nelson Gonçalves.

item.texto: The singer Nelson Gonçalves records Meu vício é você, a song by Adelino.

descricao: Santoro was one of the most restless and versatile musician of our time. The highlights of his vast catalogue are the dodecaphonic Música para cordas, the Fantasia para violino e orquestra, Verborgenheit, Ponteio and Três abstrações, these two last ones for strings, the concerts and 14 symphonies, and the Brasiliana, for orchestra.

item.texto: Born in Manaus. After revealing himself as a talented young violinist, he disembarks in Rio de Janeiro at the age of 13, with an intent to improve his instrumental skills.
Studies with Koellreutter from 1940 until 1941, year in which he composes his 2nd Sonata, defining his first period of musical compositions.
Goes to Paris where studies with Nadia Boulanger and returns to Brazil in 1950, when begins to work with children's at Tupi radio station.
Composes the Sonata nº 4, for violin and piano.

Composes Concerto nº 1, for piano and orchestra. In this time until 1958, he wins numerous of awards including the Award of Estado de São Paulo and the Golden Medal from Association of Critics of Cinema from Rio de Janeiro, for the composition of movie's soundtracks.

obras.titulo: Sonata n.4 para violino e piano

item.titulo: Sonata n.4 para violino e piano

item.texto: Is invited by German authorities for the Artistic Residency Program of West Berlin and by Brahms Foundation as Resident Artist of the Brahms House.
Works as Professor of Conducting and Composition and acts as Director of the Orchestra and Music Department of Heidelberg School of Music, in West Germany.
Composes Fantasia, for violin and orchestra.
Composes the cantata Verborgenheit, for soprano or tenor and orchestra.
Begins to prepare his opera Alma (1984), based on Oswald de Andrade's work. During this period he also composed his Fantasia Concertante Sul América, for tenor sax and orchestra.
Receives the Musical Shell award and many others along his career.

In vacation in Baden-Baden, Germany, completes his Symphony No.14. In the same year, he dies while conducting at Brasilia National Theater during rehearsal of the 2nd Concert for piano and orchestra of Johannes Brahms, frustrating the hopes of all the ceremonies of tributes prepared for him in Brazil and many other countries for his 70 years. The National Theater was baptized with his name.
As tribute, the Cultural Association Claudio Santoro was created in Brasília, with the intent of promoting his arts.

descricao: He studied with Claudio Santoro and Olivier Toni and attended the Ferienkurse fuer Neue Musik in Darmstadt in 1962 and 1968. In 1962 he created the New Music Festival and in 1963 was a signatory of the Manifesto Música Nova (New Music Manifesto). He was a pioneer of aleatory and concrete music in Brazil, using new musical notations and theatrical elements.

item.texto: At 18 years old he commenced his musical studies at the Santos Music Conservatory. Amongst his musical composition professors were Cláudio Santoro and Olivier Toni.
For the first time he participated in the Summer Course in Darmstadt, Germany. In the same year he created the New Music Festival in Santos.
He participates as a signatory of the Manifesto Música Nova (New Music Manifest).
Composes the work Beba Coca-Cola, for choral.
Participates for the second time in the Summer Course in Darmstadt, Germany.
Composes Santos Football Music.
He is a guest professor at the University of Wisconsin-Milwauke, USA, until the following year.
Composes Saudades do Parque Balneário Hotel.
His book "Uma Odisséia Musical: dos mares do sul à elegância pop/art déco" is published by EDUSP.
He receives the Comendador da Ordem do Mérito Cultural insignia from the Ministry of Culture.

descricao: Virtuous flutist, he was one of the major names of the instrumental Brazilian music. During his almost 60-year career, Altamiro Carrilho released more than 100 albums and composed about 200 pieces of different genres. He won a lot of prizes for his dedication to the Brazilian music, including the Order of Cultural Merit from the Presidency of the Republic in 1998.

item.texto: Won the Golden Microphone trophy (Troféu Microfone de Ouro) created by the Radiolândia magazine after been chosed for a juri of specialized critics and representatives of advertising agencies as the "best instrumental player" of the year on Radio.
Released by the Copacabana records the album O melhor para dançar - Flauta e órgão in a duet with the maestro and instrumentist Aloysio Figueiredo.

Won the Sharp Award on the category Best Instrumental Album for his CD Flauta maravilhosa and recorded on the following year the CD Chorinhos didáticos, which was created for people learn music by listening, playing with the playback and reading the scores that come along with the album.

His album Flauta Maravilhosa, only with his own compositions, wins the Sharp Award for best instrumental music album. In these works Altamiro shows northeastern rhythms together with carioca and classical music influence such as the track O Eterno Jovem Bach.

nome_completo: Jobim, Antônio Carlos Brasileiro de Almeida
descricao: One of the greatest Brazilian composers of all time, alongside Villa-Lobos and Pixinguinha, Antonio Carlos Jobim left a body of work comprised of more than 100 compositions, including classics that have garnered countless recordings abroad, such as the Garota de Ipanema, Corcovado and Desafinado. Considered the father of bossa nova, he created harmonies that opened up new avenues for Brazilian music.

item.texto: Begins piano studies with Hans Joachim Koellreuter. Later, he becomes a student of Lucia Branco (piano), Tomás Terán and Léo Peracchi (orchestration).

Marries his high school sweetheart Thereza Othero Hernanny. Although he studies architecture at university for a time, he quickly abanons this career for music. During this period, he moonlights as a pianist in various Rio de Janeiro bars.

Begins working for the record label Continental, writing arrangements and orchestrations for singers, including Dalva de Oliveira and Orlando Silva. While at Continental, he meets maestro Radamés Gnattali, who adopts him as a kind of "musical godson".
Has his first songs recorded: Incerteza (co-written by Newton Menonça), recorded by Mauricy Moura, and Faz uma semana (with Juca Stockler) and Pensando em você, both recorded by Ernani Filho.

His samba-canção Teresa da Praia, co-written with Billy Branco, is huge success and is released in a recording by Dick Farney and Lúcio Alves. In the same year, he composes (again, with Billy Branco) Sinfonia do Rio de Janeiro, which is released on LP by Continental, featuring interpretations by Dick Farney, Elizeth Cardoso and Lúcio Alves, among others.

Through journalist and writer Lúcio Rangel, he meets Vinícius de Moraes, with whom he establishes one of the most important partnerships in MPB (popular Brazilian music). The duo's first collaboration is the play Orfeu da Conceição, featuring music by Tom Jobim and text by Vinícius, and it makes its debut that same year at the Municipal Theater of Rio de Janeiro.

obras.titulo: Se todos fossem iguais a você

item.texto: Composes Estrada do Sol and Por causa de você, both in collaboration with Dolores Duran.

Release of the album Canção do amor demais, featuring songs by Tom and Vinícius, and recorded by Elizeth Cardoso. The album marks the release of Chega de saudade, one of the duo's biggest success and one of bossa nova's first hits.

Release of the LP Chega de saudade by João Gilberto. Apart from the title track includes the samba Desafinado, a song co-written by Tom Jobim and Newton de Mendonça, that stands as one of the gratest expressions of bossa nova.

With Vinicíus de Moraes, composes the classic Garota de Ipanema, a song that would be played 3 million times in the United States alone during 1990's and definitively cement the composer's reputation in Brazil and abroad.
Records the album The composer of Desafinado Plays, which features arrangements by the German maestro Claus Ogerman.
In New York, he records the LP Francis Albert Sinatra and Antonio Carlos Jobim.
His song Sabiá (in collaboration with Chico Buarque) wins first prize at the Third International Festival of Song, produced by TV Globo.
Release of the song Águas de Março, another of the composer's great success.

Release of the LP Matita Perê on the Phonogram label. Featuring arrangements by Claus Ogerman and Dori Caymmi, the LP includes the title track (co-written with Paulo César Pinheiro) and the newly released song Ana Luiza and soundtrack to the film Crônica da Casa assassinada.
In Rio de Janeiro, a landmark concert with Miúcha, Vinicius de Moraes and Toquinho opens and is later recorded on LP.

Releases the double album Terra Brasilis featuring the songs Vivo Sonhando, Canta Mais (with Vinícius de Moraes) and Olha Maria (with Vinícius de Moraes and Chico Buarque). In the same year, he composes the song Eu te amo in collaboration with Chico Buarque for a similarly titled film by Brazilian filmmaker Arnaldo Jabor.
Composes the soundtrack for the film Gabriela, by Bruno Barreto
Composes the soundtrack for the TV mini-series O tempo e o vento, produced by TV Globo and based on a work by Érico Veríssimo.
Release of the song Anos Dourados, co-written with Chico Buarque. The song was composed for a TV Globo mini-series of the same title.
At Carnegie Hall in New York, appears at a concert in honor of the 25th anniversary of song Garota de Ipanema.
Appears alongside Gal Costa, Winton Marsalis and Placido Domingo at the headline concert for Rio-Eco 92 and debuts the song Forever Green.
Releases his final album Antonio Brasileiro, featuring Dorival Caymmi and Sting.

descricao: He dedicated himself intensely as a music educator, teaching elementary theory, harmony, counterpoint, musical analysis, composition and orchestration.
