He published books that have been adopted by music schools in Brazil and Portugal. His works frequently performed in Brazil and overseas, include works for the piano, voice and piano, chorus, chamber ensembles, orchestra and band.

item.texto: At nine years of age he began his piano studies with Ana Veloso de Rezende, continuing them later with Maria dos Anjos Oliveira Rocha and José Kliass.

He receives first prize in the National Composition Competition City of São Paulo (Concurso Nacional de Composição Cidade de São Paulo) promoted by the São Paulo City Hall and the Composition Competition of Symphonic Works (Concurso de Composição de Obras Sinfônicas) promoted by the M.E.C Radio in Rio de Janeiro for his work Suíte Piratininga, for orchestra.
He is the first Brazilian to gain a fellowship to John Simon Guggenheim Memorial Foundation in New York, taking composition lessons with Vittorio Giannini and Aaron Copland.
He represents Brazil together with other composers in the Inter-American Composers Seminar at the University of Indiana and the III Inter-American Festival of Music in Washington, USA.
Receives the trophy "1968 Composer of Erudite Music" from the Ordem dos Músicos do Brasil.

His work Quatro peças modais for the string orchestra is given an award as the best work of that year by Associação Paulista de Críticos de Arte (APCA). He also composed Sonata para Cravo in the same year.
Once more he is honored with the first prize for the best chamber music work by APCA for Appassionato, Cantilena e Tocata, for viola and piano.
He receives for the fourth time the prize for the best chamber music work by APCA for Concerto for piccolo and string orchestra.
He receives the proze for best symphonic work by APCA for Cromos for piano and orchestra.
He writes Concertino for xylophone and orchestra dedicated to Joaquim Abreu.

descricao: Singer, songwriter, fiddler and a percussionist that dedicated his endowments by the typical pace of the Northeast of Brazil called coco and also, in specially, by loud-party samba. He sang about social problems found out in poor communities. Recorded his first single in 1969 and the first disc in 1975, that is an amount of 28 albums released a long of his career. Won 11 gold albums.

item.texto: Composed his first song called Nunca mais (in partnership with Norival Reis), interpreted by Marlene for Continental Records.
He recorded his first LP by Copacabana Records, a compact disc with songs Mana, cadê meu boi? and Viola testemunha.

Release of his LP "Bezerra da Silva - o rei do coco volume 1" by Tapecar Records, and his greatest hit was O rei do coco. The next year, by the same company, released the LP "Bezerra da Silva - o rei do coco volume 2" with highlighting song Cara de boi.
Record of a LP exclusively dedicated to samba named Partido alto nota 10 volume 1 by CID label. He also took part of TV Globo Orchestra, where he worked until 1985.
He released the CD "Pega eu" by Som Livre label. The same year he launched the CD gospel "Caminho de luz", in which he included several songs of his friends.

descricao: A Swiss-Brazilian composer, regent, pianist and professor. Beginning his studies in the Conservatory of Zurich and graduated with a degree in Piano and Composition in 1950. At the invitation of Hans-Joachim Koellreuter, he came to Brazil in 1956, where he moved to Salvador and acted as a professor at the School of Music of the Federal University in Bahia. In 1960, he became a naturalized Brazilian. Among his students stand Lindembergue Cardoso, Jamary Oliveira and Paulo Costa Lima. His vast work includes traces of Bahia musical folklore and covers several genres.

item.texto: Arrives in Brazil at the invitation of Hans-Joachim Koellreuter and starts his career as a professor at UFBA.
Widmer becomes a naturalized Brazilian.
Composed a piano piece Ludus Brasiliensis.
Composed his variation of L'Homme armé.
Composed Trilema, for voices.

He organized a unique concert consisting of afoxé and symphony at the Teatro Castro Alves in Salvador, attended the Symphony Orchestra of Bahia and afoxé group Filhos de Gandhi. At the time, his work Possível resposta de canto em canto 2, op. 169 was performed.

descricao: Composer, music critic and cultural producer, he is one of the leading names in Brazilian music creation. His catalogue include various works for symphony and chamber orchestra, oratorio, chamber music, works for chorus and vocal and instrumental soloists as well as scores for theater and cinema. His compositions have been performed frequently in Brazil and abroad.

item.texto: Born in Brusque, in the state of Santa Catarina. At 7 years old, he begins studying violin with his father, Aldo Krieger (1903-1972), violinist, composer, conductor and founder of the local music conservatory.
Joins the Conservatório Brasileiro de Música in Rio de Janeiro and begins studying counterpoint, harmony and composition with Hans-Joachim Koellreutter.
His aesthetic evolution departs from the impressionism of his Improviso for flute to surrealism with the woodwind trio Música 1945.
Receives the Música Viva award for his woodwind trio Música 1945, and then goes on to join the Grupo Música Viva of vanguard composers.
Interns for a year at the Juilliard School of Music in New York in Peter Mennin's composition class.
Is chosen in a competition to study with Aaron Copland at the Berkshire Music Center in Massachussets, United States, where he also attended classes with Darius Milhaud.
Returns to Brazil and begins working permanently as producer of musical programs for Radio MEC, where he serves as Musical Director and organizes the Orquestra Sinfônica Nacional.
Works until 1952 as a music critic at the newspaper Tribuna da Imprensa.
Studies with Ernst Krenek in the  III Curso Internacional de Verão de Teresópolis, in the state of Rio de Janeiro.
Abandons surrealism in favor of a more profound experimentation of traditional forms and language of musical theme of Brazilian character.

Receives the International Award of Peace at the Warsaw Festival for the song If We Die, about the text by Ethel Rosenberg, and the Award of the Rottelini Foundation of Rome. Composes Concertante for piano and orchestra.
As a scholar of the British Council, he studied for year in London with Lennox Berkeley in Royal Academy of Music.

Wins first place at the I Concurso Nacional de Composição, sponsored by the Department of Education, with the piece Divertimento for piano and strings. Also wins the Medal of Honour at the fiftieth anniversaty of the Theatro Municipal in Rio de Janeiro.
Receives the award Prêmio Nacional do Disco for his Quarteto nº 1, for string.
His Variações Elementares premieres at the 3rd Inter-American Festival of Music in Washington.

obras.titulo: Variações elementares para orquestra de câmara

item.texto: In this year and the following, is thanked with the Gold Medal (4th place) at the Festivais Internacionais da Canção in Rio de Janeiro, with Fuga e Anti-Fuga (lyrics by Vinícius de Moraes) and Passacalha, respectively.

In this year and the following, creates, organizes and directs the Festivais de Música da Guanabara, which in 1975 later becomes known as the Bienais de Música Brasileira Contemporânea (which he also directed until the 12th edition in 1997). Also receives the trophy Golfinho de Ouro.
Composes Canticum Naturale for orchestra.
Assumes the artistic direction of the Fundação de Teatros do Rio de Janeiro (FUNTERJ).
Creates the Projeto Memória Musical Brasileira (Pro-Memus) with the Instituto Nacional de Música da Fundação Nacional de Arte (FUNARTE), of the Ministry of Culture.
Directs the Instituto Nacional de Música until 1989.

obras.titulo: Sonâncias n.2 para violino e piano

item.texto: Composes 3 Imagens de Nova Friburgo for strings and harpsichord.
Serves as president of FUNARTE. Composes Romance de Santa Cecilia for narrator, soprano, children's choir and orchestra.
Composes Concerto para dois violões e cordas, dedicated to Sérgio and Odair Assad who performed as soloists at the 1996 world premiere in New York.
Receives a week of tributes, giving six speeches and having his music - both chamber and symphonic - played by Japanese musicians.

Composes Te Deum Puerorum Brasiliae for children's and youth chorus, Gregorian chant, brass and percussion, performed with the simultaneous utilization of three modal systems that contribute to the formation of Brazilian cultural music, composed for the official celebrations of His Holiness Pope John Paul II's visit to Rio de Janeiro.
Is elected President of Academia Brasileira de Música, occupying chair n.34, a position that remains for three consecutives terms, until 2005.
Composes Terra Brasilis, symphonic panel commissioned by Ministry of Culture for the celebrations of the 500 Years of Discovery of Brazil.

In Germany, participates at conferences, talks and round tables about Brazilian Music at the Freie Universitaet Berlin at Festival Brasil 500 anos, promoted by Karlsruhe's University of Music. Watches the execution of the six of his works while in the country.
Finalizes the creation and recording of the soundtrack, at the invitation of the director Geraldo Santos Pereira, of the feature film about the life of the sculptor from Minas Gerais, Aleijadinho.
Terra Brasilis debuts in Porto Seguro, Bahia, by the Orquestra Sinfônica da Bahia under the conductor Henrique Morelenbaum as part of the 500 Years of Discovery.
For two months, he serves as a visiting composer at Karlsruhe's University of Music in Germany.
Is named president of the Fundação Museu da Imagem e do Som, linked to the Secretary of State of Culture of Rio de Janeiro.
Holds the position of director of the Sala Cecília Meireles in Rio de Janeiro.
Composes Suíte Concertante for guitar and orchestra, dedicated to Turíbio Santos .
Watches the premiere of his works Fanfarras Modulares (2005) and Variações Carnavalescas for marimba (2004) in Rio de Janeiro.

obras.titulo: Suíte concertante para violão e orquestra

item.texto: Is resident composer of the 37º Festival Internacional de Inverno de Campos do Jordão (in the state of São Paulo). Was able, on this occasion, to see the world premiere of his piece Ritmetrias (Variantes rítmicas sobre um metro contínuo), composed at the beginning of this year just for this event.

His work Concerto para violoncelo e orquestra, dedicated to Antônio Meneses, the principal Brazilian cellist, was premiered by the honoree himself and by the Orquestra Sinfônica Brasileira at the Theatro Municipal in Rio de Janeiro.

Premiere of Abertura Carioca (Variações sobre motivos da “Cidade Maravilhosa”), composition performed by the Orquestra Sinfônica Brasileira at the inaugural concert of the Cidade da Música in Rio de Janeiro.

obras.titulo: Pequeno concerto para violino e cordas

item.texto: Release of his biographyby musicologist and professor Ermelinda A. Paz, on the day of his 84th birthday, with a commemorative concert at the Salão Leopoldo Miguez in the Escola de Música of the Universidade Federal do Rio de Janeiro.

descricao: PhD on Music from USP (São Paulo University), his catalog is comprised of more than 200 works. He has thrice been named as the Best Composer of the year by A.P.C.A. (São Paulo Art Critics Association) in 1990, 1995 and 1998 for Cecília Meireles Cycle, Postais Paulistanos and Concert for vibrafone and orchestra, respectively. He has been elected for Brazilian Music Academy in 2014. His works for orchestra include Lenda do Caipora.

item.texto: His first contact with music occurs in the family home, where he begins to play cavaquinho and guitar at the age of 9.
Completes his piano studies at the Brazilian Conservatory of Music in Rio de Janeiro.
His Concerto for piano and orchestra is performed by Orquestra Sinfônica de Juiz de Fora, conducted by Max Gefter (who is also the soloist).
He furthers his piano studies with José Kliass and spends the next three years studying composition with Camargo Guarnieri.
Composes Cinco miniaturas brasileiras.
Wins the Noneto de Munique (Münchner Nonett) competition in Germany.
Completes his Master's in Composition at the Federal University of Rio de Janeiro's School of Music.
Composes Lenda do caipora, an orchestral work.
Composes Os Borulóides.
Composes Te Deum, a piece dedicated to the city of Juiz de Fora, which is selected as the best classical work (vocal) by the A.P.C.A. in 2007.
Composes the piece Duas meninas.
Elected (Seat n. 11) to the Brazilian Academy of Music (Academia Brasileira de Música), whose patron is Domingos da Rocha Mussurunga.

descricao: Composer, instrumentalist and arranger, Sivuca is respected as one of the most important names of Brazilian popular music. Considered by speciallized critic as the musician responsible for elevating the accordion to a universal category and inserting it in jazz's and symphonic music's contexto, he is internationally recognized for his work and his talent.

item.texto: At only 9 years old, he begins performing professionally in the northeast region, playing in weddings, christenings and even circuses.
He works at Jornal do Comércio Radio, where he learns musical theory with radio's orchestra musicians. For three years, he studies harmony with maestro Guerra Peixe.

He establishes residence in Rio de Janeiro. Composes the "baiões" Adeus Maria Fulô and Fogo pagô, in a partnership with Humberto Teixeira, and the anthological choro Homenagem à Velha Guarda. He also does arrangements and records the soundtracks for two of Roberto Farias' movies: "Rico ri à-toa" and "No mundo da lua".
Records an authorial piece, the choro Homenagem à Velha Guarda and the samba Lamento do morro.
He makes his first tour in Europa playing accordion with the group "Os Brasileiros", conducted by Guio de Morais, in a divulgation of MPB abroad project promoted by the Humberto Teixeira Law.

Acts in the musical "Joy", by Oscar Brown and Jean Pace, as a musical director, instrumentalist, composer and arranger. The musical remained in theatres for a year in São Francisco, Chicago and New York.

He delivers to Chico Buarque a melody composed in 1947 and the only partnership between them emerges with the song João e Maria. He also did arrangements for the Nara Leão LP "Os meus amigos são um barato".

The album "Sivuca e Chiquinho - Todos os sons" is released with Chiquinho do Acordeon and a special participation of maestro Radamés Gnattali. Songs such as Pé de moleque, by Radamés Gnattali; O eterno jovem Bach, by Altamiro Carrilho; Valsa verde, by Capiba; Aquariana, by Sivuca; and Rabo de fita, a collaboration between Sivuca and Chiquinho do Acordeom were recorded.

He composes his first symphonic piece, the Concerto Sinfônico para Asa Branca, for a performance with the Symphonic Orchestra of Recife. In the same year, he records the song Coração do povo, the theme song for the 4th centenary of Paraíba, composed in a partnership with Marcus Vinícius.

Releases, with Rildo Hora, the album "Sanfona e realejo", obtaining good respectability from the specialized critic. The album brings songs such as San Vicente, by Milton Nascimento and Fernando Brant; Doce de coco, by Jacob do Bandolim; Os meninos da Mangueira, by Rildo Hora and Sergio Cabral; and Sanfona e realejo, by himself.
Releases the album "Um pé no asfalto, um pé na buraqueira", with special participation of Rildo Hora and playig Guararema, among others, in a partnership with Glorinha Gadelha.

Together with the composer and guitar player Baden Powell, Sivuca performs in Paris. He also continues to perform in Brazil and abroad, participating in festivals and receiving international reference for his instrumental work.

He is nominated to five categories of the award Prêmio Tim de Música, winning two: Best Arranger and Best Instrumental Album. For the CD "Cada um belisca um pouco", together with Dominguinhos and Oswaldinho do Acordeom, he also wins the award Prêmio Tim de Música.

nome_completo: Oliveira, João Gilberto Prado Pereira de
descricao: João Gilberto, one of the most emblematic figures in the history of Brazilian popular music, is considered to be the father of Bossa Nova. His innovative way of singing and playing the guitar became the baseline reference for subsequent generations.

item.texto: He moves from Salvador to Rio de Janeiro and becomes a soloist in the vocal group Garotos da Lua.
In November another 78 rpm is released with song by Tom Jobim and Newton Mendonça, Desafinado, later becomes the "anthem of Bossa Nova". Other authorship song was Oba-lá-lá.

His 78 rpm album released in August ushers in a new style of samba-choro considered the starting point of Bossa Nova. Out of this album comes the hit single Chega de saudade, written by Tom Jobim and Vinicius de Moraes. Samba appears shortly after with Elizeth Cardoso's LP “Canção do amor demais”.
Host of a weekly program on TV Tupi.
Odeon Records releases the LP "João Gilberto", which includes cover of old hits by Dorival Caymmi : Samba da minha terra and Saudade da Bahia.
Gilberto plays with a group of Brazilian artists at Carnegie Hall, in New York, USA, and then sets up permanent residence in the United States.

The American label Verve launches the 1962 Getz / Gilberto LP, becoming one of the best-selling LPs of the year. João Gilberto is now considered one of the most respected guitar players in the United States and this LP wins six Grammy Awards.
The album "Best of two worlds" is released in the United States, a collaboration with the singer Miucha and saxophonist Stan Getz.
Gilberto plays at the Municipal Theater of Rio de Janeiro.

descricao: Son of clarinetist and band teacher Paulo Moura. Moved to Rio de Janeiro with his family and joined the National Music School, where he obtained the degree of clarinetist. Studied with Guerra-Peixe and José Siqueira (harmony, counterpoint and fugue), Moacir Santos (orchestration) and conductor Cipó (arrangement). Considered one of the most important Brazilian instrumentalists.

nascimento.local: São José do Rio Preto, SP

item.texto: At the age of nine, Paulo Moura asks to study music and is given his first clarinet by his father.
Accompanies Ary Barroso in Mexico, participating in Conjunto Maciel and Orquestra Cipó at Radio Tupi.

Signs the musical direction of a show with Dolores Duran, Nora New, Jorge Goulart, Maria Helena Raposo and Conjunto Farroupilha, presented in socialist countries. Works at Radio Nacional as well as an arranger and orchestrator with his professor, Moacyr Santos.
As a saxophonist integrates Bossa Rio ensemble, with which he performs the Night of Bossa Nova at Carnegie Hall in New York.

Releases LP entitled "Confusão urbana, suburbana e rural" (Urban, Suburban and Rural Confusion), which he performed abroad. This LP was considered a milestone for Brazilian popular instrumental music, fascinating both audiences and the critics, specialized in mixing afro-suburban percussion, woodwinds and chorões.

On May 13rd conducts the Orquestra Sinfônica de Brasilia performing a piece of his own composition for percussion and orchestra entitled "Concerto da Abolição" (Abolition Concert), a concert in celebration of the Abolition of Slavery Centenary, which exclusively presented music composed by Brazilian black composers.

Releases the CDs "Dois irmãos", with Raphael Rabello, and "Rio Nocturnes". Is awarded the Sharp Award for the Best Popular Instrumentalist category, and receives the best soloist award at the Mozart Festival in Moscow.

Releases CD "Pixinguinha" with Os Batutas group, for which he received the Sharp Award in the categories of Best Instrumental CD and Best Instrumental Group, and in 1999 with Cliff Korman releases the CD "Modo ingenuo".

His "Fantasia Urbana para Saxofone e Orquestra Sinfônica" was performed at Teatro Municipal do Rio de Janeiro. On the same year received the Latin Grammy in the category of Best Regional Music Album for his album "Pixinguinha", recorded with Os Batutas.
Releases CD "Estação Leopoldina" and on the following year releases with guitarrist Yamandú Costa the album "El negro del blanco" on CD as well.

Releases CD “Samba de latada” (2007) in partnership with Josildo Sá, and on the following years releases “Pra cá e pra lá – Paulo Moura trilha Jobim e Gershwin” (2008), and “AfroBossaNova” (2009), in partnership with Armandinho.

descricao: Kilza studied composition with Camargo Guarnieri. PhD in anthropology, she founded the Brazilian Folklore Association and took part in UNESCO’s project The Universe of Music: a History. With ten awarded works in national contests (Ricordi, MEC and Funarte), her catalogue has about 70 musical pieces for various formations. She occupies chair n.9 of the Brazilian Music Academy.

item.texto: Having initiated her piano studies with Leonilda Morganti, at eight years old she goes on to receive orientation from the pianist and composer Fructuoso Vianna.

After graduating in piano from the São Paulo Musical and Dramatic Conservatory and earning a scholarship for the composition course with Camargo Guarnieri – with whom she studied until 1961, Kilza receives a scholarship from the Torcuato di Tella Institute at the Latin Center of High Musical Studies, to go on with her composition studies.

Kilza goes to Lisbon after winning a scholarship from the Calouste Gulbenkian Foundation, where she worked under orientation of the ethnomusicologist Michel Giacometti and of the composer Fernando Lopes Graça.

Kilza concludes her PhD studies in social anthropology by USP, with a thesis on the music of fishermen from the northern coast of São Paulo. Since then, she acts as a guest professor in various universities around the country.

Kilza’s musical work was subject to two concluded researches this year: a doctoral thesis in the University of Boston, USA, by cellist Darylin Manring; and a master’s dissertation in the State University of Campinas (Unicamp), by pianist Nancy Bueno.

descricao: Being self-learned, at the age of 10 he learned basically alone to play accordion, flute and saxophone, among others instruments. When he was 15 years old, Pascoal was already considered the best accordion player of the waste, although he didn't know to read music. In the following years, he played in Rio de Janeiro, São Paulo and also in other countries. He received many awards during his career, including the Prêmio Sharp of best musical arrangement and the Prêmio Ary Barroso, in 1996.

item.texto: Hermeto had his first recorded composition, which was part of the LP Quarteto Novo.
He recorded his first disk in USA, where he showed arrange innovations using bottles among the instruments.
Hermeto recorded his first solo LP: A música livre de Hemeto Pascoal. This LP was recorded in a farm, among the animals.
Also recorded in the US, the LP Missa dos escravos was also well received and praised by critics.
Hermeto Pascoal released the CD Bodas de Latão, in duet with Aline Morena, celebrating seven years of union in life and music.

descricao: Jocy de Oliveira is a pioneer in the development of multimedia work in Brazil and her works involve theater, texts, videos projects and multimedia displays. She is the first among the Brazilian composers to compose and direct her own operas. She has composed, written and directed her eight operas which were presented in several countries. Jocy de Oliveira is a member of the Brazilian Academy of Music and she is internationally renown.

item.texto: She studies piano with José Kliass from 1946 to 1953, when she goes to Paris, France, to have lessons with Marguerite Long.
Publishes her first book, O 3º Mundo, by Melhoramentos.
Publishes the theater play Apague meu spot light, edited by Massao Ohno.
Finishes the composition course at the Washington University, Saint Louis, US.
Publishes Dias e Caminhos seus Mapas e Partituras, by Record in Brazil and by Lingua Press, US.
Composes her first opera of the trilogy - Inori a prostituta sagrada, ordered by Fundação Vitae and produced by Centro Cultural Banco do Brasil, with 16 performances.

Composes the second opera of the trilogy - Illud Tempus, ordered by RIOARTE with 20 performances in Rio de Janeiro, São Paulo and Belém. This work won the competition for the Municipal Theatre and was selected by newspaper O Globo between top ten events this year.
With new version, Fata Morgana obtains success at the Museu de Arte Moderna in Rio de Janeiro and also at the Municipal Theatre in São Paulo.
Composes As Malibrans, the last work of the trilogy, a Brazil-Germany co-production ordered by RIOARTE. This work debuted in Brazil at the Centro Cultural Banco do Brasil.

obras.titulo: Ofelia caught by the piano strings

item.texto: Debuts As Malibrans at the Staadts Theater Darmstadt, Germany.
Publishes her opera Inori – a prostituta sagrada, by Spectra.

obras.titulo: Who cares if she cries... (voz e violoncelo)

item.texto: Composes the opera Kseni – A estrangeira, the first part ordered by Dresdner Tage der Zeitgnösischen Musik, debuts such as a concert in Dresden. Writtes Who Cares If She Cries for soprano and strings, dedicated to Roberto Minczuck.

obras.titulo: Who cares if she cries... (voz e orquestra)

item.titulo: Who cares if she cries... (voz e orquestra)

item.texto: Debuts in Rio de Janeiro at the Carlos Gomes Theater the opera Kseni – A estrangeira, and later presents this work in São Paulo at SESC Pinheiros.
Kseni is performed at Ludwigshafen Festival, in Germany.
Her fifth book – Diálogo com cartas is released by Civilização Brasileira.

descricao: He studied with Camargo Guarnieri and graduated in Composition and Conducting at the Musical Conservatory of Santos in 1973. He is a founding member of the Brazilian Society of Contemporary Music, the Brazilian Society of Electroacoustic Music, the Paulista Academy of Music and the Campineira Academy of Music. He was professor at UNICAMP, where he retired. In 1994 he was elected member of the Brazilian Academy of Music.

item.texto: His work Estrias IV, for cello, represented Brazil at the 26th International Tribune of Composers, UNESCO, 1979, and was featured on the composition of the international Tribune for Latin America and the Caribbean/TRIMALCA, UNESCO, São Paulo, 1980.
Received the Paulista Association Critics Art Award/APCA, for Contextura, best symphonic work.
Encadeamento, for five basses, represented Brazil at the 28th international Tribune of Composers - UNESCO, Paris, 1981.

descricao: At the age of 9, he received the award for Best Solo Guitar from National Radio. In adulthood, he began playing jazz in clubs and then made his first recording with the invitation of Altamiro Carrilho. He accompained many singers like Alaíde Costa, Lúcio Alves, Angela Maria, among others. For all the work, he won the XV Shell Prize for Brazilian Music.

item.texto: He began his professional career at age of 15 with permission of the Juvenille Court, playing in the underground bars in Rio de Janeiro, at Carioca area.
The song Lapinha, composed in a partnership with Paulo César Pinheiro, becomes a hit in the voice of Elis Regina.

descricao: Born in interior of Bahia, Elomar knows the minstrels Zé Krau and Zé Serradô when he was only 7 years old. In his youth, he moves to Salvador to study architecture but goes back to his homeland in 1964. At this time, his musical creation intensifies and he begins to compose merging the local traditions and symphonic music.

item.texto: He records a single disc with the songs O Violeiro and Canções da catingueira inspired by medieval traditions.

Releases the LP "Das barrancas do Rio Gavião", with a introduction by poet Vinicius de Moraes where we can find praise to the work of Elomar. The songs bring fidelity to the characteristic local language and are influenced by European medieval music.
The LP "Na Quadrada das Águas Perdidas", recorded in UFBA studios with participation of Xangai and Ernst Widmer, is released.

The LP "Parcele Malunga" with participation of Xangai, Zé Gomes and the great pianist Arthur Moreira Lima is released. In this album stand out the songs O violeiro, As curvas do rio, Cantiga de amigo and Chula no terreiro.
Elomar performs at Teatro Municipal de São Paulo in his show "ConSertão", with his partners Arthur Moreira Lima, Paulo Moura and Heraldo do Monte.
The album "Cartas catingueiras" is released, where stand out the songs Cantiga do estradar, História de vaqueiros, Faviela, Gabriela, Incelença para um poeta morto and Duvê esse chão quêma meus pé.
He is awarded at the Ibero-American Festival, in Germany, for his LP "Dos Confins do Sertão".
The LP "Elomar em Concerto", recorded this year at Cecília Meireles Hall, in Rio de Janeiro, shows the symphonic ideas of the composer.
The album "Árias Sertânicas" is released this year, whose idea is to show to the pubic excerpts of his operas, such as the songs Dança da fogueira and Agora sou feliz.
Elomar performs at Ibirapuera Hall, in São Paulo. The show features songs like Campo Branco, Cantiga de Amigo, A Função and Na Estrada das Areias de Ouro.

He performs with his son and guitar player João Omar at SESC Vila Mariana, in São Paulo, the show named "Ensaiando o riachão do gado brabo". The same year, the exhibition "Ocupação Elomar" is held at Itaú Cultural, in São Paulo, bringing life memories of the composer and his work.

descricao: Martinho began his career at age of 15. As a former laboratory technician in the Army, he later became a songwriter and samba composer when dismissed from it. At GRES Vila Isabel, samba school in which he became the honorary president, he modified the samba-enredo making it faster than it was usually played. Besides being a singer and composer, he also is the author of 10 books.

item.texto: In the 4th Festival da Record he releases Casa de Bamba, one of his classics.
He releases the LP "Canta, canta minha gente", achieving huge success.
This year is released the documentary about his life "O Pequeno Burguês - Filosofia de Vida".

He releases by Biscoito Fino label the CD "Poeta da Cidade" in honoring Noel Rosa works and interprets 14 songs alongside singers Aline Calixto, Ana Costa, Analimar, Maíra, Mart'nália and Patrícia Hora.
In his DVD "Enredo", Martinho records all his sambas-enredos, among them Carnaval de ilusões, Gbalá viagem ao templo da criação, Vila Isabel anos 30 and Ai que saudades que eu tenho.

descricao: He graduated on Composition and Regency at UFBA Music School. There he acted as a bassonist and he was a professor of composition and other disciplines. He was also a member of the Brazilian Academy of Music, occupying the chair number 33. Received many national and international awards. He had 24 of his compositions recorded and many others edited, in Brazil and abroad.

item.texto: Lindembergue joined the Bahia Federal University Music Seminars, working under orientation of Ernst Widmer.
Composes Pleorama, for the orchestra.

Lindembergue finished his degree in Composition and Regency in UFBA, acting as a madrigalista (singer), percussionist and bassoonist of the University's Symphonic Orchestra. He was also a professor of Composition.
Cardoso wrote Nove Variações, for bassoon and string orchestra.

He passes away in Salvador, leaving about 110 works. Among them, Espectros, for choir and orchestra; Influência e Sedimentos, for strings; Captações, for vocals, chamber orchestra, turntable and radio, among others.

descricao: One of the most celebrated Brazilian composers, he was awarded Spain's Tomás Luís de Victoria Prize in 2006, the first time the prize was ever awarded unanimously, amongst a field of 57 composers from 17 countries. The international jury noted the "excellent trajectory, transcendence and global reach of his work, as well as the originality of his aesthetic thinking".

item.texto: Studies piano and musical theory at the Conservatory of Music of Pernambuco and harmony and counterpoint with Father Jaime Diniz, until 1959.

Earns a diploma in harmony and counterpoint from the Ernani Braga Institute. He also composes his first piece, a Concertino for piano and string orchestra. In a composing competition, his work Homenagem a Ernesto Nazareth, written for piano, is awarded a prize by the German-Brazilian Society of Recife.

obras.titulo: Homenagem a Ernesto Nazareth para piano op.1a

item.texto: Studies composition with H.J.Koellreutter and in the following year, with Camargo Guarnieri.

His work Divertimento wins an award in the Ernesto Nazareth Competition in Rio de Janeiro. Wins a scholarship from the Rockfeller Foundation and studies composition at the Torcuato Di Tella Institute's Latin American Center for Advanced Musical Studies in Buenos Aires. There, he studies under Alberto Ginastera, Olivier Messiaen, Riccardo Malipiero, Aaron Copland and Luigi Dallapiccolla.
His piece Ukrinmakrinkrin is awarded a Jornal do Brasil prize in Rio de Janeiro. The work is performed in various countries, including Austria, Hungary, Finland and Ireland.
Studies electronic music with Vladimir Ussachevsky at the Columbia-Princeton Electronic Music Center in New York.
His work Concerto breve is awarded the Golden Dolphin prize by the Museum of Image and Sound in Rio de Janeiro.
Named musical director of Radio MEC, the National Symphony Orchestra and the Globo Network's Concerts for Youth, until 1976.
Wins several Personalidade Global da Música awards for Best Composer.
Becomes the first director of FUNARTE's National Institute of Music.
Composes Ciclo nordestino IV for piano, one of a series of similar works composed in the 1960s and 1970s, and Sonata para piano - sobre tema de Béla Bartók.
Among numerous important honours, he receives the Gold Medal for Cultural Merit from Pernambuco.
Invited by the Brahms Society to become composer-in-residence for one year at the Brahms House in Baden-Baden, Germany.
Establishes and directs the association Juventude Musical do Brasil. Composes Tango para piano.
Named president of the Brazilian Academy of Music, a position he holds until 1993.
Serves as president of UNESCO's International Music Council until 1987.
Receives the highest honours from Texas Christian University, USA - the Cecil and Ida Green Honors Chair - and from University of Indiana - the Thomas Hart Benton Medallion.
Composes Frevo n.2 para piano, in homage to Ariano Suassuna's 80th birthday.

descricao: Member of the Brazilian Academy of Music. Teacher and conductor of the Chamber Orchestra of UNIRIO, member of the Board of Trustees and programmer of the Municipal Theater of Rio de Janeiro. After the American premier of his work Transparências, Carnegie Hall (NY), 1996, New York Times stated: "Transparências of Ricardo Tacuchian creates captivating colors and contrasting textures for piano and vibraphone".

item.texto: He starts studying music with Nelly Adelino dos Santos, and at age 9 starts composing.
He presents in public for the first time as a composer with Imagem carioca, for string orchestra. He also composes Dia de Chuva, for orchestra.

obras.titulo: Divertimento para Violino e Orquestra de Cordas

item.texto: He writes Concertino for flute and string orchestra, dedicated to James Strauss.

obras.titulo: Concertino para flauta e orquestra de cordas

item.texto: He becomes professor of the Letters and Arts Center of the Federal University of the State of Rio de Janeiro (UNIRIO).

During the 70s, composes eight Estruturas, for different instrumental groups, balanced work between experimentalism and emotion. Among them, they highlight Estruturas sinfônicas and Estruturas verdes, being the last one for violin, cello and piano.

Directs the greatest instrumental group of the history of Brazilian music: a band with two thousand musicians, a Brazilian traditional and popular music program in the Praça da Apoteose, in Rio de Janeiro.

obras.titulo: Sinfonieta para Fátima para orquestra de cordas

item.texto: Obtained his doctorate in composition from the University of Southern California.
Receives this year the medal of merit Carlos Gomes. The following year, composes Omaggio a Mignone, for wind quintet and piano.

American premiere of his Transparênciais, at Carnegie Hall in New York. The New York Times publishes critical "Transparências of Ricardo Tacuchian creates captivating colors and contrasting textures for piano and vibraphone".
Writes Avenida paulista, a piano study dedicated to José Eduardo Martins.

Releases the CD Estruturas, in Rio Arte Digital label, with more than 60 live performances of his work, twenty percent abroad. Among these performances stand out first two world premieres: Toccata Urbana for wood quartet, piano and string quintet, at North/South Consonance Ensemble, in New York, and the Quarteto de Cordas nº 3, at Filodrammatici Theater in Milan.
Toccata Urbana is first introduced in Brazil this year, under regency of the author, by occasion of the 14th Brazilian Contemporary Music Biennial.
Composes In Memoriam a Lopes-Graça, dedicated to José Eduardo Martins and Água forte, for two pianos, dedicated to Duo Gastesi-Bezerra.

obras.titulo: Castanha do cajú n.2 para piano a 4 mãos
Reply to Christopher Bochmann para piano

item.texto: Composes Arcos da Lapa and Litogragravura, among other works.

obras.titulo: Praia vermelha para quinteto de metais

item.texto: Composes Cinco paráfrases, dedicated to Maria Haro.

descricao: Being a composer and professor, Guilherme Bauer is one of the leading composers of the avant-garde movement, born in the 1940's and 50's. He was a student of Cláudio Santoro, Esther Scliar and Guerra-Peixe. Bauer was won a total of 8 awards in composition, such as the ESSO award of erudite music (Prêmio ESSO de Música Erudita), the Latin-American award of the UFBA (Concurso Latino-Americano da UFBA) and the award of the society of artistic culture of São Paulo (Prêmio da Sociedade Cultura Artística de São Paulo).

item.texto: Organised the group Ars Contemporanea. For 7 years, this group hel several performances so as to divulgue the Brazilian music repertoire.
Receives for his work Quarteto de Cordas nº 2 the APCA Award (Associação Paulista de Críticos de Arte).
As a scholarship holder from Vitae de Arte, he wrote Cadências para Piano e Orquestra.
Bauer is nominated as a member of the Brazilian Academy of Music and ocupes the chair n.17.
Receives for his Cadências para Piano e Orquestra the APCA award (Associação Paulista de Críticos de Arte).

descricao: A singer and composer. He loved singing as a child and debuted in public during the show "Enzo de Almeida Passos". In 1961 he records his first album "Lana". He became famous among the public in the time of "Jovem Guarda" group and achieved great success with the song Coração de papel, written by himself. He won more than 20 golden discs.

item.texto: He composes the song Coração de papel, which became a hit during the time of Jovem Guarda group.
He records his first album of country music with the song Menino da gaita.
One of the year's hit songs is Pinga ni mim, written by Elias Filho and recorded by Sérgio Reis.

He takes part in the soap opera "Pantanal", aired on extinct TV Manchete, starring as Tibério who, together with Almir Sater as Xeréu Trindade, sang songs telling the life in Pantanal such as Comitiva Esperança, composed by Almir Sater and Paulo Simões.
He forms a duo with Almir Sater, called "Pirilampo e Saracura", in the soap opera "O Rei do Gado" on TV Globo.
Records his first DVD called "Sérgio Reis e filhos - violas e violeiros", also with the participation of his own sons.

In celebration of more than 40 years of friendship and partnership with Renato Teixeira, they both release the CD and DVD live album "Amizade Sincera", including the best classics of Brazilian country music.
He receives the Latin Grammy for Best Country Music Album for "Questão de Tempo".

descricao: João learned to play guitar with his father and started composing to some groups in Meier, where he lived. He debuts professionally with the song Corrente de Aço, recorded by Elizeth Cardoso. He also participated in the foundation of samba school Tradição and was reponsible for the creation of Clube do Samba to preserve and disseminate the samba tradition.

item.texto: Elizeth Cardoso records his song Corrente de Aço in LP named "Falou e disse".
João becomes a member of composer's group in samba school Portela.
He records his first individual album "Morrendo em versos".
Releases the album "Espelho". The title song, composed in a partnership with Paulo César Pinheiro, would be a big success.

descricao: He started playing the accordion at age 6 in street markets in the interior of Pernambuco. His songs De volta pro meu aconchego, in a partnership with Nando Cordel and recorded by Elba Ramalho and Isso aqui tá bom demais, with Chico Buarque and recorded by them both, where included in the TV Globo soap opera "Roque Santeiro", achieving great popularity.

item.texto: He goes living with his father and older brother in the suburbs of Nilópolis, where on Saturdays he participates in forró parties. He decides to find Luiz Gonzaga who offers him an accordion.
He presents himself at Radio Nacional and also in nightclubs. Records his first LP with forró songs called "Fim de Festa".
He forms a musical duo with singer-songwriter Anastácia.

He plays for the first time at Tereza Rachel Theatre in Copacabana, Rio de Janeiro, in a show with Luiz Gonzaga named “Volta pra curtir”, conceived by Caetano Veloso and Gilberto Gil and directed by Jorge Salomão.
Joins the band playing with Gal Costa at MIDEM, in Cannes, France, and follows the singer in her tour show called "Índia".
Presents himself at the 2nd International Jazz Festival, in São Paulo.
He is a remarkable presence in the show Som Brasil, from TV Globo.
His song Tantas palavras, a partnership with Chico Buarque, is successfully recorded by Chico in the album "Chico Buarque".

His records' sales rise due to the success achieved with the songs written in partnership with Nando do Cordel: the romantic song De volta para o aconchego, recorded by Elba Ramalho, and the forró song Isso aqui tá bom demais, recorded with Chico Buarque. Both songs are included in the soundtrack of the soap opera Roque Santeiro, from TV Globo.
He creates the Asa Branca project, sponsored by Caixa Econômica Federal, bringing people free shows in public plazas in Minas Gerais, Goiás, Tocantins, among others.

Releases the album with two CDs "Dominguinhos e convidados cantam Luís Gonzaga". Composes the soundtrack from the movie "O cangaceiro", directed by Aníbal Massaini Neto. The Editora Globo releases "Dominguinhos" , a CD and fascicle from the collection MPB Compositores.

descricao: ​Brazilian musician, producer, composer and writer. His career is longer 40 decades, he participated of popular music festivals at the Rede Record (Brazilian TV channel) and composed soundtracks for many movies. In 1967, his first record was released and was called Domingo com Gal Costa (A Sunday with Gal Costa). In the next year Caetano Veloso was the leader of the movement called Tropicalismo. ​He composed songs such as Alegria, Sozinho, Baby and Cajuína.

item.texto: In 1968, record his first individual LP, Caetano Veloso, with some arranges by Rogério Duprat and collaboration of the RC-7 and Os Mutantes. This LP vinyl was released in 1970.

Received his first Golden Disc Award, for the album Outras palavras and 100,000 copies were sold. In the next year, Caetano, João Gilberto and Gilberto Gil released the album Brasil. The authors received the Vinicius de Moraes Award, in the category "best singer".
It was released the album Cores, nomes that was the reason for Caetano receive his second Golden Disc Award.
The publisher company Lumiar released the Songbook "Caetano Veloso". There were two boxes with the lyrics and music score for all 135 songs.
Releases CD "Prenda Minha", with which he will reach for the first time, in 1999, the range of more than one million copies sold with the song "Alone", by the composer Peninha.
Caetano received the Multishow Music Award in the category of best singer. In the same year, went for a tour around Brazil with the concert named Noites do Nortel.
Released the album Cê with brand new songs composed by him.
He performed for the fist time at the Circo Voador the tour of the album Abraçaço. Also in 2013 Caetano received pre-indications to the 14th edition Grammy Latino.

descricao: A singer-songwriter, wrote his first songs when he was 8. At age of 14, forms his first band "Os Tijucanos do Ritmo", in which he played the drums. The band was active for only one year. He studies classical guitar and forms the band called "Os Sputniks", with Roberto Carlos and Erasmo Carlos as members. Tim had been their classical guitar teacher.

item.texto: Before he was 17, and with his father's death, he goes to the United States where he takes an English course and starts his career as a singer by taking part in a band called The Ideals.
Back to Brazil, releases his first album with the songs Meu país, composed by himself, and Sentimento, written by his fellow band member Cassiano. The album had great success.

He records his first LP “Tim Maia”, which stands out the songs Azul da cor do mar (written by himself), Primavera (by Cassiano and Sílvio Rochael) and Coroné Antônio Bento (by João do Vale and Luiz Wanderley). This last song was originally released in 1959 with the different title Matuto transviado.

He joins the sect Rational Culture and, inspired by the book "Universo em desencanto", he composed the songs O Grão Mestre varonil, Bom senso, O caminho do bem. He records the LP "Tim Maia Racional volumes 1 e 2".

Records the LP "Tim Maia Disco Club" with the participation of Banda Black Rio, Pepeu Gomes playing the guitar and the singer Hyldon, who plays the guitar in the song Sossego, one of Tim Maia's greatest hits.
Releases the LP "Tim Maia", with the greatest hit Do Leme ao Pontal.

Releases "Tim Maia Interpreta Clássicos da bossa nova", with a few known songs such as Garota de Ipanema, by Tom and Vinicius; Meditação, by Tom and Newton Mendonça and Eu e a brisa, by Johnny Alf, among others.

Releases 4 CDs : "Amigos do rei - Tim Maia e Os Cariocas",  "Pro meu grande amor", " Só você - para ouvir e dançar", " Sorriso de criança" and "What a Wonderful World". He also recorded a few American pop/soul classics from the 1950s and 1970s.

descricao: He began his musical life studying guitar and then drums. Professionalized playing songs of his own in jazz and bossa nova strongholds. Your first studio recording, 1963, was a crooner of two of his compositions. He achieved international fame and was the winner of the 7th Festival Internacional da Canção.

item.texto: Releases his first LP "Samba esquema novo", with songs of his own that became great success such as Mas que nada, Balança a pema and Chove chuva.
He won the VII Festival Internacional da Canção with Fio Maravilha, song performed by Maria Alcina.
He releases the LP "A tábua de esmeralda".
The LP “África Brasil” brings new successes as Taj mahal, Camisa 10 da Gávea and Xica da Silva, all of his authorship.
Lauches the LP "Salve simpatia" with songs that became success such as Ive Brussel, and the LP title song.
“Ao vivo no Rio”, Jorge Ben Jor album released this year, brings the first W/Brasil recording, a great success of his authorship.

descricao: Brought up in an environment of great musicians like Pixinguinha and Jacob do Bandolim, he started early to learn how to play the guitar. His first samba was created for the organized carnival revelers troupe Bloco Carnavalesco Foliões de Anália Franco. His first paid work was at the Zicartola restaurant, where he got the nickname from Zé Keti and Sérgio Cabral. He was awarded a prize at the VI TIM Music Prize under best singer, best album and best song.

item.texto: Recorded by Elizeth Cardoso on the LP album "Elizeth sobe o morro", the samba Rosa de ouro composed in a partnership with Élton Medeiros and Hermínio B. de Carvalho, was a great hit.
Recording of Memória de um sargento de milícias, Portela Samba School theme-song which was established as the carnaval winner that year.

obras.titulo: Memória de um sargento de milícias

item.texto: Paulinho da Viola composes the great hit which definitively scored his career, the samba Foi um rio que passou em minha vida, recorded on the LP album of the same name.

obras.titulo: Foi um rio que passou em minha vida

item.titulo: Onde a dor não tem razão

descricao: Milton began his career when he was 13 years old as a crooner. In Belo Horizonte he met Fernando Brant and Marcio Borges, with whom had a fruitful collaboration. He released his 1st international album "Courage" in 1968. He is one of the most important Brazilian composers and singers. He won a Grammy for best CD from World Music in 1998.

item.texto: At the age of 2, he already played piano at his grandparents house. Shortly after, he received his 1st instrument, an accordion.
He receives his first guitar at the age of 13. During this time, he befriended Wagner Tiso, and together him created "Luar de Prata", his first group.
He moves from Três Pontas to Belo Horizonte.
One of his most known and recorded songs, Travessia, is placed in 2nd in the International Song Festival and Milton is elected the best performer. He records his first LP "Milton".
His LP "Courage", with 10 songs among them Travessia, is recorded and released in United States.
Records the LP “Clube da Esquina”, the first sample of a musical movement with the same name, together with Márcio Borges, Fernando Brant, Beto Guedes, Toninho Horta, Nelson Ângelo and Wagner Tiso.

His album "Milagre dos Peixes ao Vivo", recorded at Municipal Theater of São Paulo, is the first album of MPB being recorded with a symphony orchestra, with musical arrangements by Wagner Tiso, Radamés Gnattali and Paulo Moura. The Symphony Orchestra of Rio de Janeiro regency was under the responsability of Paulo Moura.
He releases his album "Minas", composed with great successful songs such as Ponta de Areia.
He writes and plays the track for "Maria Maria" ballet, that marks the premiere of Corpo dance group in Brazil and abroad.

Six years after his first album "Clube da Esquina", releases "Clube da Esquina 2", with the cooperation of many songers and composers such as Flávio Venturini, Beto Guedes, Chico Buarque and Francis Hime, among others.
Records the LP "Sentinela" in a partnership wth Fernando Brant, achieving a huge success.
Carnegie Hall premiere, in New York, achieving a great success among the public.
After many international tours, the first fan club of the composer is founded in Tokyo.
HIs album "Txai" reached the first place in the list of Billboard's magazine Music World.
He records the CD "Amigo" at Arts Palace in Belo Horizonte, with the São Paulo Jazz Symphony Orchestra and two children choirs.
His CD "Nascimento" wins Grammy award for Best World Music Album.
Receives  Doctor Honoris Causa title by Federal University of Ouro Preto. Wins Latin Grammy for CD "Crooner" in the category Best Contemporary Pop CD.

descricao: He started his career composing instrumental works but from 1961 started to getting interested in electronic music. He founded in 1962 the Estudio de Pesquisas Cromo Musicais, standing out as the precursor of electronic music in Brazil. He published two CDs of his works and three books in the series "Sons Novos".

item.texto: Begins to take an interest in electronic music, while was entering in the course of Physics of the National Philosophy Faculty (FNFi).
He composes the first Brazilian work done exclusively with electronic sounds: Valsa Sideral.

Starts important research in the field of correspondence between sounds and colors and composes a series of works, which gives the name "cromoplastofonia" for orchestras, magnetic tapes, lights, also using the senses of smell, taste and touch.
Stands out as one of the most representative names in avant-garde Brazilian music and participates in many national and international festivals.

He is invited by Villa-Lobos Institute of Rio de Janeiro to organize his Center of Musical Research. He was nominated Teacher of Electroacoustic Music of the same Institute, where he starts to teach composition classes and where transfers his laboratory.
Wins a scholarship for postgraduate studies in composition from Torcuato Di Tella Institute of Buenos Aires, where he works for two years. Composes Cinta Cita.

Continues his research in Sonology Institute of University of Utrecht, with a dutch government grant. He specialized in Computer Music under the guidance of Gottfried Michael König, Greta Vermeulen, Stan Tempelars and Fritz Weiland. Among his importatn works of this period is Music for Eight Persons Playing Things.

wins a French government scholarship for a refresher course at the Groupe de Recherches Musicales de l'ORTF, where he works as a composer-trainee under the guidance of Pierre Schaeffer, Guy Reibel and François Bayle. In the same period he began his Doctorate in Musical Aesthetics at the Sorbonne University of Paris VIII, having Daniel Charles as a guide.
He is invited by the University of Brasilia to direct the Course in Musical Composition of Music Department, where becomes professor.
Founds the GeMUnB (Musical Experimentation Group), a set of eight musicians who specialized in contemporary music and lived-electronics and makes a concert tour in Europe.
From that date until 1989, wrote several works politically engaged, kid of aesthetic movement which incidentally has always been linked, but always with a vanguardian musical language forefront.
Dates from this time his famous Sinfonia das Diretas (Sinfonia das Buzinas). He also composes Dramatic Polimaniquexixe for clarinet solo and piano.
It is also of his own authorship the polemic Hino Nacional Alternativo (Hino ao Novo Brasil) due to the promulgation of the new constitutional charter on this date.

As a composer in residence at the Ateliers UPIC, works in the field of computer music and match picture and sound, making the tapes of electronic sounds, to be used simultaneously with the symphonic part of his new opera – Olga. In the same year receives the Recommended Award from International Tribune of Composers of UNESCO.

Elected member of the Brazilian Academy of Music. He had special participation in the Bourges Electroacoustic Music Festival in France, and received the Creative Music Award Londrina Festival, in Paraná. That same year he organized and coordinated the First Meeting of Electroacoustic Music in Brasília, where was founded the Brazilian Society for Electroacoustic Music.
He organizes and directs the II Meeting of Electroacoustic Music in Brasília, this time on an international character.

Receives the 1998 Estancias Prize from the Ministry of Culture of the Spanish government. With this prize Antunes gave master classes in Musical y Electronics Information Technology Laboratory (LIEM) of Madrid, where he worked during the July-August period performing new electroacoustic works.

Writes two grand choral-symphonic works on the occasion of the celebrations of the 500th anniversary of Brazil: Cantata dos Dez Povos, ordering the University of Brasilia and Sinfonia em Cinco Movimentos, commissioned by the Ministry of Culture.

He is once again in Brazil Festival SIMC in the city of Yokohama in Japan. For this festival has selected his work Hombres tristes y sin título rodeados de pájaros en noche amarilla, violeta y naranja.
Receives from the Ministry of Culture of France the title of Chevalier des Arts et des Lettres, one of the most important honorary title awarded by the French government.
He organizes and coordinates the III International Meeting of Electroacoustic Music in Brasilia.

Premiere his work Blaue Elegie für Nikolaus von Myra, for mezzo-soprano and 8 cellos. The composition is 25 minutes long and was commissioned by the foundation Stichting Dijkverzwaring from Netherlands, for Cello Octet Iberian Group, directed by Maestro Elias Arizcuren.

descricao: Songwriter, singer, guitar player, Gil is the one most creative and active name of all MPB - Música Popular Brasileira. Recognized Artist, Gil recorded more than 50 albums and received several awards and commendations in Brazil and around the world, including 8 Grammys.

item.texto: The group As Três Baianas records his song Bem devagar, where Gil plays accordion.
Shown his music Domingo no parque with the group Os Mutantes in the 3rd Brazilian Popular Music Festival produced by TV Record and reaching second place.
Gal Costa sang Divino, maravilhoso in the 4th Brazilian Popular Music Festival TV Record reaching 3rd place. The song achieved huge success and became the name of television program.
Gil and Caetano were arrested in São Paulo by military dictatorship. Both were taken to armys facilities in Marechal Deodoro, in Rio de Janeiro.

Release the record Tropicália or Panis et circensis. Gil composed for this album songs as Panis et circensis, Lindonéia and Batmakumba (all of them with Caetano), Miserere nobis (with Capinan) and Geléia geral (with Torquato Neto).
Gil and Caetano went to exile in London. Before departure is released the song Aquele abraço, one of the biggest hits of that year in Brazil.
Gil came from exile. His family moves from Salvador to Rio de Janeiro and Gil releases new LP containing success as Back in Bahia, Ele e eu, Expresso 2222, O sonho acabou and Oriente.
Gil releases the record Refazenda with new success including Lamento Sertanejo in partnership with Dominguinhos.
Gil, Caetano, Gal and Bethânia get together to sing and create the group Doces Bárbaros. The shows became a movie from Tom Azulay and a double LP containing the song Esotérico, among others.

Release a single with the song Não chore mais, Gil version for the reggae No woman, no cry, which becomes one of his biggest hits and turn with O Bêbado e a Equilibrista by Aldir Blanc and João Bosco, a hymn of amnesty in Brazil.
Releases the album Raça Humana containing the hit Vamos Fugir.

He is honored along Caetano, Gal and Bethânia the GRES Mangueira in Rio de Janeiro Carnival with the theme Atrás da verde e rosa só não vai quem já morreu, and Mangueira became champion of the Carnival that year.
Gil presents the first live show of Brazilian artist broadcast in real time on internet. Release also on the web the music Pela internet.
Gilberto Gil takes over the Ministry of Culture of President Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva.
Releases the record Banda Larga Cordel.
He resigned from the post of Minister of Culture.
Releases the record Fé na Festa.

descricao: One of the most important artists of the post-bossa nova generation; author of classics such as Upa, neguinho (with Gianfrancesco Guarnieri) and Beatriz (with Chico Buarque). He took part in various song festivals and was a Prize winner in 1965 with the song Arrastão (with Vinícius de Moraes) and in 1967 with Ponteio (a partnership with Capinam).

item.texto: He starts his professional career performing in night clubs with Dorival Caymmi and Marcos Valle. The following year he records his first single.
Composes the theme song for Ra-tim-bum, a TV show for children produced by TV Cultura in São Paulo. It was then recorded in CD and released by Shap.
He was awarded the Shell music prize for Best composer of Brazilian Music for his lifetime achievement.
He was awarded - with Chico Buarque - the Latin Grammy Award in the category MPB for the CD Cambaio.

Released the CD Edu Lobo e The Metropole Orkest, recorded live (2011) in the Beurs van Berlage Theatre, Netherlands, with arrangements by Gilson Peranzzetta (piano and accordion) and special participation of Mauro Senise (flute and saxophone).

descricao: He valued two qualities: originality and esthetic freedom. It was said he was completely free to used in his music elements of nationalism, atonalism, tonalism and references to ecology, religion and mysticism. He was professor of music at Instituto de Artes da Unicamp (Unicamp Art Institute) where he taught for 25 years.

item.texto: Almeida Prado lives his nationalism fase. From this period highlights the composition Missa da Paz.
At universalist fase wins the first place at I Festival de Música da Guanabara (I Guanabara Muic Festival) with his composition Pequenos Funerais Cantantes and receives a trip to Europe.
In France he studies with Nadia Boulanger and Olivier Messiaen.
He retourns to Brazil. in this period, he refers as "ecological and astronomical fase" for been created works that's refers to animals, plants and celestial bodies, as example: Exoflora.
Assigned by the Ministry of Culture, composed the work Oré-Jacytatá - Cartas Celestes n°8 for violin and orchestra to celebrate the 500th anniversary of Brazil Discovery.

obras.titulo: Da carta de Pero Vaz de Caminha

item.texto: Wrote Concerto para oboé e cordas, dedicated to his friend and artist Lucius Mota.

Composes one of the most delicated and tonals works that's were heard in the Bienal de Música Brasileira Contemporânea (Contemporary Brazilian Music Biennial) of that year, with the beautiful variations for piano Caderno de Mariana and Caderno de Gabriel, dedicated to his two grandchildren.
Author of about 600 musical works, died prematurely in complete activity.

descricao: Brazilian composer and conductor, he got awards in his country and abroad, with works released in Venezuela, Germany and the United States. Laureate for his works devoted to Theatre (Moliere Prize) and Cinema, he is a member of the Brazilian Academy of Music. His mentors: Lúcia Branco, Magda Tagliaferro, Camargo Guarnieri, Alceu Bocchino, Francisco Mignone.

item.texto: A native from São Paulo, he moved to Rio de Janeiro where he studied vocal technique with Eliane Sampaio and musical analysis with Ester Scliar.
He got the First Prize in the Musical Ballads Contest named " I jogos Florais de Normalistas da Guanabara" with the piece Duas Trovas Populares de Pernambuco.

After spending time in the United States, he returns to Brazil where received many awards, such as the First Prize on popular vote in the Guanabara Musical Festival - with Poemas do Cárcere - a cantata for baritone, chorus and orchestra about poems by Ho Chi Min.
Composes Cantos novos & vazios for soprano and piano.

He became director of the Free University of Music (Universidade Livre de Música) and the  International Music Festivals of Campos do Jordão (Festivais Internacionais de Música de Campos do Jordão), until 1997.

descricao: The youngest amongst 14 brothers, he started studying classic guitar on his own when he was 18 years old. He later became a teacher at the Music Conservatory in João Pessoa, where he taught classical guitar and musical theory classes. In 1975 he moved to Rio de Janeiro where he participated in several major artistic events among which the play Gota d'Água by Chico Buarque.

One of the greatest name of all time from the Brazilian popular music, Chico Buarque is essential reference in the Brazilian music history from the 60's until the recent days. Among his uncountable top songs there are: A Banda, Construção, Roda Viva and many others.

item.texto: Chico's first composition comes up in his fifteens, the song called Canção dos Olhos.

Performed on TV show Fino da Bossa, which was presented by Elis Regina. Chico quickly conquered the public's acknowledge. In the next year releases his debut compact disc with songs Pedro Pedreiro and Sonho de um carnaval. As well, he has composed songs for poetry Morte e Vida Severina from João Cabral de Melo Neto, whereby it was awarded in IV Festival de Teatro Universitário, in Nancy, France.

Chico spends a long period without performing, but keeps on producing. He writes the play Gota d`Água, in partnership with Paulo Pontes, for which they won the Molière award. Composes the song Vai trabalhar vagabundo, for the movie with homonym name and the song O que será, written for the movie Dona flor e seus dois maridos.
Released by the publisher Companhia das Letras, his new book O Irmão Alemão, which quickly became one of the most remarkable books of the year.

descricao: A musician, composer and retired professor from the Federal University of Bahia, Jamary Oliveira has concluded his doctorate in Composition by the University of Texas in 1986 and was elected a member of the Brazilian Academy of Music in 1994. Founding member of the Grupo de Compositores da Bahia (Composers Group of Bahia) he has composed for diverse formations. Some of his most proeminent pieces are O Sertão (1964), Sanctus (1971) and Piano Pièce (1984).

item.texto: Composes Conjunto 1, the first of a series of four pieces.
Composes the second piece of the series, Conjunto 2.
Composes Conjunto 3 and Conjunto 4, concluding the series.
Concludes his master degree on Composition at the University of Brandeis, United States.
Concludes his doctorate in Composition at the University of Texas, United States.
Was elected as president of ANPPOM (National Association of Research and Post-Graduation in Music).
Was elected a member of the Academia Brasileira de Música (Brazilian Academy of Music) taking the 35th seat.
Composes his piano piece Estudo Polirrítmico.
Composes Mutação I and Mutação II, electronic music.

descricao: Son of Luiz Gonzaga, he lived in Rio de Janeiro taking part in samba events in Estácio neighborhood. There he met Ivan Lins and Aldir Blanc who, like him, would be revealed by university festivals. His song Comportamento geral, against military dictatorship, achieved big success but he was persecuted by censorship.

item.texto: He composed his first songs, Lembranças da primavera, Festa and From US of Piauí, that would be recorded for his father in 1967.
His song Pobreza por pobreza is one of the finalists in 1st Universitary Popular Music Festival of Rio de Janeiro.
Together with Ivan Lins, Aldir Blanc and César Costa Filho, among others, Gonzaguinha creates the MAU - Universitary Artistic Movement.
He participates in the 5th International Song Festival with the songs Um abraço terno em você, viu mãe? and Mundo novo, vida nova, which were recorded in an album.
He records his first LP, "Luiz Gonzaga Jr".
The LP "Plano de vôo" is released and Gonzaguinha travels in a tour together with Paulinho da Viola to Brazil Northeast region.
Records the LP "Começaria tudo outra vez" achieving huge success with title track Espere por mim, morena.
He records the LP "Coisa mais maior de grande" and travels in a tour with his father Luiz Gonzaga presenting the show "A vida do viajante".
The biggest success of Gonzaguinha, the samba O que é o que é, is one of the songs of LP “Caminhos do coração”.
He is awarded with Prêmio Sharp in the category Best MPB Song for É.
The book "Gonzaguinha e Gonzagão – Uma história brasileira", by Regina Echeverria, is published.

descricao: Compositor e escritor, Abel Silva é compositor de mais de uma centena de canções. Parceiro de Sueli Costa, João Bosco, Fagner, Roberto Menescal, João Donato dentre outros, ganhou dois prêmios Sharp de melhor música por Voz de mulher e Sempre você.

Member of the group Clube da Esquina, great success in Brazil and abroad, he founded in 1970 the band Som Imaginário, starting to play concerts and recordings with important names of Brazilian music such as Milton Nascimento. He was elected by critics the Best Arranger in 1974 and 1975. Launched in 2009 the album Samba e Jazz - um século de música. In 2011, he released the album Outras canções de cinema, all original songs.

item.texto: Wagner Tiso is a part of the band Sambacana.
After two years in Sambacana, Wagner reunities with his master Paulo Moura, with whom he had studied musical theory and keyboards.
Composes the soundtrack for the movie Os deuses e os mortos, by Ruy Guerra.
Join the band Som Imaginário, wich accompained the Milton Nascimento's performances.
He is responsible for the soundtrack of A lira do delírio, a movie by Walter Lima Jr.
Composes the soundtrack for Poema sujo, by Ferreira Gullar.
Wagner is responsible for the soap opera's soundtrack Dona Beija, a big hit by the Brazilian TV channel, Manchete.
Composes the miniseries soundtrack O sorriso do lagarto, from the TV channel, Globo.

descricao: Singer, songwriter and guitarist. He grew up in an environment where music was part of everyday family life. His first partner was Vinicius de Moraes. In Rio de Janeiro he met Aldir Blanc, who has partnered and produced classics such as O Bêbado e a Equilibrista, an anthem for political amnesty. Consecrated unique style, in a powerful rhithmic division dictated by the boldness and subtlety of his left hand,

item.texto: Travels on vacation to Rio de Janeiro and meets Aldir Blanc for the first time, who would start a long and fruitful partnership with.
Bala com bala is the first song of the duo recorded by Elis Regina in hes LP Ela.

Intensifies his production with Aldir Blanc partnership that would result in success as two sambas that bursted this year: De frente pro crime, recorded by Simone, adn the historic Mestre sala dos mares, which is recorded by Elis Regina and pays tribute - in the form of samba-enredo - to the sailor João Cândido, "Black Admiral", the leader of the Revolta da Chibata.

descricao: The name by which young Antonio became known as was given to him by his mother as a child. In adolescence, knowing to play the guitar, he performed in clubs and colleges, but the improvement only came about after his friendship with Baden Powel. He participated in a major musical TV Record. With Vinicius de Moraes, he formed one of the best MPB doubles of all time, with about 120 songs.

item.texto: Lua cheia, Toquinho's first melody that received Chico Buarque lyrics.

Participates in a tour of Italy with Chico Buarque. Records the album “La Vita, Amico, É L'Arte Dell'Incontro”, with songs by Vinicius de Moraes translated to Italian by artists such as Giuseppe Ungaretti and Sergio Endrigo.
Together with Vinícius de Moraes and Miucha, he participates in a show at Canecão, in Rio de Janeiro. The show was in theaters for almost a year due to the great success of three partners.
Composes the song Que maravilha, his first success in a partnership with Jorge Benjor.
With Maria Bethânia on vocals, Toquinho and Vinícius recorded a new LP in La Fusa.
The LP “ São demais os perigos dessa vida” is released with songs that would be great hits of Toquinho and Vinícius, such as Para viver um grande amor, Regra três, Cotidiano nº2, among others.
Toquinho performs at Castro Alves Theater, in Salvador, together with Vinicius and Clara Nunes in the show “O poeta, a moça e o violão”.
In a partnership with Vinicius de Moraes, he composes the soundtrack for the soap opera “Fogo sobre terra”, by TV Globo, with the songs As cores de abril and Como é duro trabalhar.
Records the album “Vinicius e Toquinho”,which highlights the song Onde anda você, in a partnership with Hermano Silva.
The album “Casa dos Brinquedos”, with children's songs, becomes the theme for a show on TV Globo in commemoration of Children's Day.

descricao: Iniciou como compositor e baterista ainda na adolescência, quando atuou no Teatro Azul e participou do grupo Rio Bossa Trio. Participou de grandes festivais da MPB e do MAU (Movimento Artístico Universitário) quando conheceu João Bosco, com quem compôs inúmeros sucessos interpretados por Elis Regina. Foi um dos fundadores da Sombrás e da Saci, Sociedade do Artista e Compositor Independente.

His artistic career began in 1968. With one of his partners, Geraldo Azevedo, he wrote weveral songs including Caravana, Talismã and Táxi lunar. In 1980 he released the album "Coração Bobo", whose title track quickly became a huge success. Two years later, he would release the album "Cavalo-de-pau", wich has definitively consolidated his career.

item.texto: He begins his artistic career performing at show "Erosão: a cor e o som", together with the band Underground Tamarineira Village, later named Ave Sangria.

He moves to Rio de Janeiro to continue his artistic career. There he met old fellow from Northeast Geraldo Azevedo, with whom Alceu formed a partnership. With Azevedo he composed several hits, including Caravana, Talismã and Táxi lunar.

Back to Recife, he acts in "A noite do espantalho", a musical movie written and directed by the composer Sérgio Ricardo, also participating of the soundtrack. In this same year, he recorded his first individual album "Molhado de suor", wich was nominated by the journalist and composer Nelson Motta as the best release of the year.

With the singer Jackson do Pandeiro, he presents for the project "Seis e Meia" at João Caetano Theater, in Rio de Janeiro. He also participated in the Abertura Festival, on TV Globo, with the song Vou danado pra Catende, inspired by some verses of his fellow-countryman poet Ascenso Ferreira. Because of this, the festival organization created an award for "best research work" especially for him.
Releases the album "Espelho Cristalino". He tours the country with the singer Jackson do Pandeiro, another illustrious citizen of Pernambuco, performing shows at the Pixinguinha Project.
Launches the album "Coração bobo".
Launches the album "Cavalo-de-pau", which has definitively consolidated his career highlighting the big hits Como dois animais and Tropicana.
Releases the album "Anjo avesso" whose highlight Anunciação, a composition of his own, has become one of the biggest success in that year.
Besides his old friends Elba Ramalho, Zé Ramalho and Geraldo Azevedo, he crosses through the country in a serie of historical presentations called "O Grande Encontro".
Celebrating 30 years of carrer, he performes the CD "De Janeiro a Janeiro" releasing concerts at Fundição Progresso, Rio de Janeiro.

descricao: Composer, pianist and arranger, Cristóvão Bastos is highly respected by his peers. However, only after 30 years of his career he recorded his first solo album "Avenida Brasil", which includes pieces in a partnership with Chico Buarque and Paulinho da Viola. Among his works are Todo Sentimento, Resposta ao Tempo and Suave Veneno.

item.texto: Cristovão participated in the album "Memórias chorando" by Paulinho da Viola, together with the flutist Copinha.
Being one of the Black Rio Band's founders, Cristóvão takes part in its first formation as well as the album "Maria Fumaça", released this year.
The album "Francisco" by Chico Buarque is released, which includes the song Todo sentimento – a partnership with Cristóvão Bastos.
Together with guitarist Marco Pereira, Bastos releases the album "Bons Encontros" which was awarded the Prêmio Sharp that year for the category Best Album of Instrumental Music.

His first solo album "Avenida Brasil" is released including the hits Os três chorões, Mandacaru, Um choro pro Valdir (together with Paulinho da Viola) and Avenida Brasil, as well as Todo sentimento, among others.
In a partnership with Aldir Blanc he composes the song Resposta ao tempo, performed by Nana Caymmi and awarded the Prêmio Sharp for the category Best Music.
Cristóvão composes the soundtrack to the movie "Zuzu Angel" by Sérgio Rezende, released on CD by Universal label.
Cristóvão was awarded with Prêmio Tim de Música for the category Best Arranger for the album "Acústico MTV", by Paulinho da Viola.

descricao: A composer, arranger, instrumentalist and music producer, Egberto began his musical education the age of six at the Conservatório de Música de Nova Friburgo (Nova Friburgo Conservatory of Music). Later, he studied popular and folkloric music. He has mastered a variety of instruments and was one of the first Brazilian musicians to use synthesizers. He has written soundtracks and musical scores for cinema, theater, ballet, TV series and art exhibitions.

item.texto: Studies piano with Jacques Klein and Aurélio Silveira. Earns a scholarship to study in Vienna, Austria, with the intent to dedicate himself to popular music. Competes in TV Globo's 2nd International Festival of Song in Rio de Janeiro with the composition O Sonho, interpreted by Os Três Morais.
Competes in the 3rd International Festival of Song with O Sonho, an arrangement for 100-piece orchestra.
Studies in France with Jean Barraquê (1928-1973) and Nadia Boulanger (1887-1979).
Composes his first film score - A penúltima donzela, directed by Fernando Amaral.
Composes his first musical score for theater - the play Maria Minhoca by Maria Clara Machado.
Performs in his first international show at the San Remo Music Festival in Italy.
Records his first LP, Egberto Gismonti.
He works for a year and half in Europe as arranger and director of Marie Laforêt's backing orchestra.

Records two EPs in France and two LPs - one in the former Federal Republic of Germany (Orfeo Novo) and the other in Italy. With Polygram, he releases his LP Sonho 70 in Brazil, which features Janela de Ouro and Mercador de Serpentes. He enters te latter piece in the 5th International Festival of Song competition in the same year.
Records 3 more LPs on the Odeon label: Água e Vinho, in which he plays, among others, the title track, A Traição das Esmeraldas and Ano Zero.
Releases the LP Egberto Gismonti.

Distinguishes himself with the songs Tango, Encontro no bar and Luzes da Ribalta, all of them co-written with Geraldo Carneiro, and Academia de Danças, in which instrumental playing is more prominently featured.
Composes the score for the ballet Maracatu, performed by Ballet Stagium. He goes on to compose for numerous dance companies in Brazil and abroad.
Releases the duet Dança das Cabeças, with percussionist Naná Vasconcelos, which is nominated for Album of the Year by Stereo Review and awarded a Grober Deutscher Schallplattenpreis prize.
Composes the score for the ballet Corações futuristas, which is coreographed by Vítor Navarro and performed by the Dance Company of the Municipal Theater of São Paulo.
Releases Sol do Meio Dia, which features saxophonist Jan Garbarek, guitarist Ralph Towner and percussionist Collin Walcott.
Releases the LPs Sol do Meio Dia and Nó Caipira.
Composes the score for the ballet Conforme a altura do sol, conforme a altura da lua, perormed by Ballet Stagium.
With Naná Vasconcelos and Walter Smetak, releases the LP Egberto Gismonti & Naná Vasconcelos & Walter Smetak.
Releases the LP Solo, which sells 100,00 copies in the United States.
​With Dulce Bressane, composes soundtracks for the children's films A Viagem do Vaporzinho Tererê and O País das Águas Luminosas.
​Records Folk Songs ​with bassist Charlie Haden and saxophonist Jan Garbarek. The trio goes on a European tour, which includes a concert at the Berlin Jazz Festival.
Releases the LP Em Família.
Releases the LP Cidade Coração.
Releases the LP Egberto Gismonti.
Composes his first soundtrack for a fine arts exhibition - Os muito universos e Ita-Parica, by Marilda Pedroso.
Relases the LPs Duas Vozes (with Naná Vasconcelos) and Trem Caipira.
Composes soundtracks for the exhibitions Figueira Branca,by Akiko Fujita and Os sete anéis, by Antonio Peticov.
Releases the LP Alma.
Releases the LP Feixe de Luz.
Composes the score for the ballet Natura, choreographed by Laura Dean and performed by Laura Dean Dancers and Musicians, from United States.
Releases the LP Dança dos Escravos, in which he plays 6, 10, 12 and 14 string-guitars.
Composes the soundtrack for the film Kuarup.
Releases the album Infância.

Composes the score for the ballet Iemanjá. Choreographed by Joe Alegado for Tanz-Forum, the work is performed by Cologne Opera Ballet and accompanied live by the Cologne Phillarmonic. It is the first of various works he would compose for ensembles in Germany.
Records the album Amazônia.
Composes the soundtrack for the film El Viaje.
Releases the album Casa das Andorinhas.
Composes the soundtrack for the film Amazônia.
